Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Pewter City Gym, Brock, has a preference for
   :    : Rock-type Pokémon and Earth-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Rock-type
   :    : Pokémon, Earth-type Puppets are weak to Hydro, Nature,
   :    : and Cryo-Typed moves.
  @>Text: Earth-Type Puppets resist damage from Miasma, Pyro,
   :    : Poison, and Rock-type moves, and are immune to
   :    : Wind and Electric-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: Brock has opted to keep him gym simple for the sake
   :    : of beginning challengers to the Gym Challenge.
  @>Text: Despite constant criticisms that his Gym doesn't stand
   :    : out when compared to other gyms, Brock has remained
   :    : resolute in his decision.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Aside from being a Gym Leader, Brock is a well
   :    : respected Pokémon Breeder, known across the
   :    : world.
  @>Text: As Brock is often called away for Breeder-related reasons,
   :    : the curator of Pewter Musuem, Miles, will take over as 
   :    : Brock's replacement Gym Leader.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

   :    : the gym that you wish to challenge them again.

  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(3)],(021,026), Up
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(3)],(017,012), Left
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Brock],(015,005), Down
  @>
 : Branch End

Options Enabled

@>Text: \xn[Brock]Welcome to Pewter Gym! My name is Brock, the Gym Leader. I specialize in Rock-type Pokémon and Earth-type Puppets.
@>Text: \xn[Brock]When it comes to battling, I believe that the best offense is a good defense. You'll find it extremely difficult to break past my defenses!
@>Text: \xn[Brock]Think you have what it takes? Then come on, show me your best!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
@>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 0
@>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 0
@>Comment: EndSpeech: You're stronger than I expected. Impressive work, challenger!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:LEADER_Brock, "Brock", 1+$player.badge_count)
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Not bad at all, challenger! I applaud your skills! As proof of your victory, I confer upon you the Boulder Badge!
 @>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Boulder Badge!\wtnp[90]
 @>Script: $player.badges[0]=true # Boulder Badge
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Having the Boulder Badge will allow your Pokémon or Puppets to use the move Flash outside of battle.
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Flash is a skill that Pokémon and Puppets can learn that will illuminate dark
  :    : areas, such as caves.
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Speaking of TMs and SCs, here, take these as well!
 @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:TM39) # Rock Tomb, Pokemon
 :       : pbReceiveItem(:SC39) # Rock Tomb, Puppet
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
  @>Text: \xn[Brock]What I just gave you is a Technical Machine and a Skill Card, which allow you to teach moves to your Pokémon and Puppets.
  @>Text: \xn[Brock]There are also special Field Move variants called Hidden Machines and Hidden Skill Cards.
  @>Text: \xn[Brock]All of these have an unlimited number of uses, so you can teach them to any number of your Pokémon or Puppets!
  @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Those are the Rock Tomb TMs and SCs. A rather simple move that'll make rocks fall down on your target, with a chance of lowering their speed as it 
  :    : traps them.
 @>Text: \xn[Brock]Be sure to put them to good use, they'll definitely help give you an advantage in battle!
 @>Control Switches: [0004: Defeated Gym 1] = ON
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(19,"A",true)
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(21,"A",true)
 @>
: Branch End
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = OFF
@>

 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Pewter City Gym, Brock, has a preference for
   :    : Rock-type Pokémon and Earth-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Rock-type
   :    : Pokémon, Earth-type Puppets are weak to Hydro, Nature,
   :    : and Cryo-Typed moves.
  @>Text: Earth-Type Puppets resist damage from Miasma, Pyro,
   :    : Poison, and Rock-type moves, and are immune to
   :    : Wind and Electric-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: Brock has opted to keep him gym simple for the sake
   :    : of beginning challengers to the Gym Challenge.
  @>Text: Despite constant criticisms that his Gym doesn't stand
   :    : out when compared to other gyms, Brock has remained
   :    : resolute in his decision.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Aside from being a Gym Leader, Brock is a well
   :    : respected Pokémon Breeder, known across the
   :    : world.
  @>Text: As Brock is often called away for Breeder-related reasons,
   :    : the curator of Pewter Musuem, Miles, will take over as 
   :    : Brock's replacement Gym Leader.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Preference
  @>Text: The Pewter City Gym, Brock, has a preference for
   :    : Rock-type Pokémon and Earth-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Rock-type
   :    : Pokémon, Earth-type Puppets are weak to Hydro, Nature,
   :    : and Cryo-Typed moves.
  @>Text: Earth-Type Puppets resist damage from Miasma, Pyro,
   :    : Poison, and Rock-type moves, and are immune to
   :    : Wind and Electric-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1
  @>Comment: Gym Mechanics
  @>Text: Brock has opted to keep him gym simple for the sake
   :    : of beginning challengers to the Gym Challenge.
  @>Text: Despite constant criticisms that his Gym doesn't stand
   :    : out when compared to other gyms, Brock has remained
   :    : resolute in his decision.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 2
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Information
  @>Text: Aside from being a Gym Leader, Brock is a well
   :    : respected Pokémon Breeder, known across the
   :    : world.
  @>Text: As Brock is often called away for Breeder-related reasons,
   :    : the curator of Pewter Musuem, Miles, will take over as 
   :    : Brock's replacement Gym Leader.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 3
  @>Comment: Gym Rebattle Protocol
  @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0118: Gym Rematch in Prog?] == ON
   @>Comment: Gym elsewhere has a challenge in progress.
   @>Text: You currently have a rematch in progress for \v[127]. 
    :    : Please complete your challenge there first before 
    :    : challenging another gym to a rematch.
   @>Jump to Label: Start
   @>
  : Else
   @>Comment: Can rematch the current gym
   @>Text: This will send a notification to the Gym Leader and all 
    :    : trainers in the gym that you wish to challenge them again. 
    :    : Is that acceptable?
   @>Show Choices: Yes, No
   (When Cancel: Choice 2)
   : When [Yes]
    @>Text: To complete the protocol, you must choose a team set 
     :    : for the gym to use.
    @>Text: Take note, you can not select a team set higher 
     :    : than your total badge count.
    @>Control Variables: [0002: Temp Move Choice] = 0
    @>Input Number: [0002: Temp Move Choice], 2 digit(s)
    @>Conditional Branch: Script: $game_variables[2] > $player.badge_count+1
     @>Text: Invalid input, challenger does not have the requisite badge count.
     @>
    : Else
     @>Text: Confirming, you want the team set the gym uses set 
      :    : to as if you had \v[2] badges?
     @>Show Choices: Yes, No
     (When Cancel: Choice 2)
     : When [Yes]
      @>
     : When [No]
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : When [No]
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :       :         :MIKOFOSSIL,  :MAGIFOSSIL][pbGet(1)]

 :       : if item
 :       :   data = GameData::Item.get(item)
 :       :   pbSet(2, data.name)
 :       : end
 @>Text: So, the \v[2] is what you want?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Text: A fair trade this is then! Your gemstones for my fossil!
  @>Script: pbReceiveItem(pbGet(1))
  @>Script: completeQuest(:Quest101)
  :       : pbSetSelfSwitch(20,"A",true)
  @>Control Self Switch: B =ON
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>Jump to Label: Fossil Selection
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Text: It looks like you're still short a few. You should be able to find more
  :    : at various quarries across the region.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #3
Conditions
Self Switch B is ON

(Repeat Action)
$>Turn at Random

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 022
Event Name: EV022
(X,Y): (024,036)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Here's the idea. The Shiny Yorihime fight will utilize Scripted Battles
 :       : to create a battle where Yorihime will swap out with Reisen/Rei'sen
 :       : Puppets randomly at the end of evey turn.
@>Comment: Depending on what is or isn't possible, the Reisen and Rei'sen
 :       : Puppets will become the new active battlers. The player has to
 :       : defeat them before Yorihime comes back onto the field.
@>Comment: If that isn't possible, then the Puppets will attack the player at the
 :       : end of the turn, and Yorihime will come back to the battle before
 :       : the start of the next turn.
@>

@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 8 frame(s)
@>Transfer Player:[048: Route 4], (014,024), Up
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
@>Wait: 6 frame(s)
@>Change Save Access: Enable
@>Text: Did you get a good haul? Hopefully you come back again!
@>Control Variables: [0112: Dig Spot Variable] = 0

Freq: 3: Low

@>Comment: Have a loop here which will re-enable all of the dig spots
@>Script: for event in $game_map.events.values
:       :   if event.name[/Dig Spot/i]
:       :     $game_self_switches[[$game_map.map_id,event.id,"A"]] = false
:       :   end
:       : end
:       : $game_map.refresh
@>Script: setTempSwitchOn("A")
@>

Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$player.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

Options Enabled

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Hey there, my name's Misty! As you can see, I'm the 
 :    : leader of the Cerulean City Gym!
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0118: Misty's Gym Challenge] < 3
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]As Gym Leader, I am under obligation to accept 
  :    : your request for battle, however!
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]I will only battle you if you can beat the other three 
  :    : trainers in here. You need to prove that you're a worthy 
  :    : challenger.
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Misty]And, well, it seems you've beaten all the trainers here, 
 :    : so sure! I'll accept your challenge!
@>Text: \xn[Misty]But get ready, my Water and Hydro-types aren't going to go 
 :    : easy on you!
@>Script: setBattleRule("backdrop", "cerulean")
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
@>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 1
@>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 1
@>Comment: EndSpeech: You're way too good for me!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:LEADER_Misty, "Misty", 1+$player.badge_count)
 @>
: Else
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Not bad at all! I was sure we were going to win that 
 :    : battle. Oh well, a loss is a loss!
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Have this Cascade Badge, as proof you bested the 
 :    : Cerulean City gym!
@>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Cascade Badge!\wtnp[90]
@>Script: $player.badges[1]=true # Cascade Badge
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Before you go, take this as well.
@>Script: pbReceiveItem(:TM70) # Water Pulse, Pokemon
:       : pbReceiveItem(:SC03) # Water Pulse, Puppet
@>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]What I just gave you is a Technical Machine and a Skill Card, which allow you to teach moves to your Pokémon and Puppets.
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]There are also special Field Move variants called Hidden Machines and Hidden Skill Cards.
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]All of these have an unlimited number of uses, so you can teach them to any number of your Pokémon or Puppets!
 @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Both the TM and the SC are Water Pulse, a Water- and Hydro-Type 
 :    : move that Pokémon and Puppets can learn which has a chance to confuse 
 :    : their foes!
@>Text: \xn[Misty]A pretty nifty move, wouldn't you say?
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(12,"A",true)
:       : pbSetSelfSwitch(13,"A",true)
@>Control Switches: [0005: Defeated Gym 2] = ON
@>

 @>Text: \xn[Misty]You know the rules, I won't battle you until you
  :    : beat the other trainers in my gym!
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: \xn[Misty]Are you all set? I've been training hard since our last
 :    : battle!
@>Script: setBattleRule("backdrop", "cerulean")
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Rematch to Ball Check
@>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 1
@>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 1
@>Comment: EndSpeech: You're even better than before!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:LEADER_Misty, "Misty", pbGet(128))
 @>Text: \xn[Misty]Haha, you're quite enjoyable to battle! I'll look forward to
  :    : your next rematch! Don't be a stranger, okay?
 @>Control Switches: [0118: Gym Rematch in Prog?] = OFF
 @>Script: $game_variables[127] = nil
 :       : $game_variables[128] = nil
 :       : 
 :       : for event in $game_map.events.values
 :       :   if event.name[/GT_/i]
 :       :     $game_self_switches[[$game_map.map_id,event.id,"B"]] = false
 :       :   end
 :       : end
 :       : 
 :       : $game_map.refresh
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 007

(X,Y): (023,038)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Cerulean City Gym, Misty, has a preference for
   :    : Water Pokémon or Hydro Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Water-type
   :    : Pokémon, Hydro-type Puppets are weak to Wind, Nature,
   :    : and Miasma-typed moves.
  @>Text: Hydro-Type Puppets resist damage from Metal, Pyro, Cryo,
   :    : and Hydro-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: In order to progress through the gym, challengers will
   :    : need to battle all trainers in the gym before the leader
   :    : accepts their challenge.
  @>Text: As of late, this system has also been used to deter
   :    : would-be suitors for the Gym Leader, gaining these
   :    : trainers the title of "Misty's Elite Guard."
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: The Gym Leader, Misty, is one of the owners of the 
   :    : Cerulean Aquatic Show, where she and her sisters
   :    : put on underwater performances with various
   :    : Pokémon and Puppets.
  @>Text: While Misty herself is not known for performing often in the
   :    : shows themselves, she often takes up the role of narrator
   :    : while her sisters put on performances.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 : Branch End

   :    : trainers the title of "Misty's Elite Guard."

 : Branch End

   :    : Cerulean Aquatic Show, where she and her sisters

   :    : shows themselves, she often takes up the role of narrator
   :    : while her sisters put on performances.

  @>
 : Branch End

  @>Text: This will inform the Gym Leader and all trainers in 
   :    : the gym that you wish to challenge them again.
  @>Call Common Event: Gym Rematch Protocol
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer],(015,028), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer],(029,028), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer],(022,011), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Misty],(022,021), Down
  @>Control Variables: [0118: Misty's Gym Challenge] = 0
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$player.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

  :    : up on Route 25.

  :    : discharges me.

  :    : fail it would continue to happen!

  :    : mysterious. You wouldn't mind helping to see what's going on

Conditions

Graphic: trainer_FISHERMAN

Autonomous Movement

Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Did you go check out what's going on inside my house?
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0117: Nue Sidequest Checker] == 2
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: ... So the disturbance was caused by a Chibi Nue puppet?
  :    : Aw fiddlesticks, that Puppet stalked me from my old place
  :    : all the way in Ecruteak City!
 @>Text: You managed to chase it off, right? Well, I appreciate
  :    : your help here!
 @>Text: I just hope it didn't take anything from any of my boxes... It
  :    : won't be a significant loss if it did, but it's played several
  :    : pranks on me in the past!
 @>Text: Here, I promised I'd give you stuff worth your time if you
  :    : helped me.
 @>Script: $bag.add(:MYSTICWATER)
 :       : $bag.add(:SWIMSUIT)
 @>Text: \me[Item get]You recieved a \c[1]Mystic Water\c[0] and a \c[1]Swimsuit\c[0]!\wtnp[40]
 @>Text: You put the items away \nin the <icon=bagPocket1>\c[1]Items Pocket\c[0].

  :    : or Puppet's Water- and Hydro-type moves.

  :    : have this.

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 001
Event Name: Renko/Maribel
(X,Y): (010,007)

Page #1
Conditions
Variable 0107: Chosen Protag is 0 or above

Graphic: trainer_SCMary

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Memorize BGM/BGS
@>Play BGM: 'P-012. Girls' Sealing Club', 100, 100
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch A == OFF
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]\pn, you made it! It's been a while since we last saw 
  :    : each other! How've you been so far?
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I've traveled quite a ways across the Kanto region,
  :    : and I've seen some remarkable sights. This world truly is 
  :    : fascinating!
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I've also gotten a lot stronger while on the road, and I
  :    : kind of want to put myself to the test again!
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.

@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)

 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0

 :    : Moon Mining Tunnels.
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch B == OFF
 @>Text: It's quite a fascinating phenomenon, really. While we 
  :    : were excavating one day, we happened to come 
  :    : across a series of mysterious tunnels.
 @>Text: They all seem to lead somewhere, but we haven't been
  :    : able to figure out just where they lead... It's quite peculiar!
 @>Text: We have managed to find other tunnels that seem to connect
  :    : with this series of tunnels, all across the Tohjo Continent. The
  :    : best part? They all have rare artifacts inside them!
 @>Text: With an almost limitless supply of artifacts coming out of them,
  :    : Curator Miles decided to open the tunnels up to the public, all
  :    : in the hopes of expanding the museum's displays.
 @>Text: First, prospective prospectors would pay a small entrance fee
  :    : to enter the mines, which all goes back to the Museum. This helps
  :    : us pay for upkeeping the mines and the museum.
 @>Text: In return, for the price of admission, visitors can enter the 
  :    : tunnels and search for artifacts of their own.
 @>Text: To limit environmental impact, guests are limited to one visit 
  :    : per day. Wouldn't want the caves to collapse in on us, now 
  :    : would we!
 @>Text: With that all said...
 @>Control Self Switch: B =ON
 @>

@>Text: Would you like to enter the mines? The cost of entry is $5000!
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)

  @>Text: Sorry, I can't let you in if you don't have the money to pay
   :    : the entrance fee. Come on back when you have enough
   :    : money!
  @>
 : Else

   :    : yourself!

 : Branch End
 @>

 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Vermilion City Gym, Lt. Surge, has a preference for
   :    : Electric Pokémon and Wind Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Electric-type
   :    : Pokémon, Wind-type Puppets are weak to Earth-typed
   :    : moves.
  @>Text: Wind-Type Puppets resist damage from Aero and 
   :    : Wind-typed moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: Lt. Surge, using his expertise in warfare, has designed his 
   :    : gym to reflect a training ground for recruits.
  @>Text: There are two ways to navigate the gym. The first is 
   :    : through a gauntlet of trainers, which Lt. Surge calls the 
   :    : "Head-On Course".
  @>Text: The second one requires navigating a simulated battlefield
   :    : with Voltorbs littered in the ground as landmines. Tripping a
   :    : landmine will send you back to the beginning of that course.
  @>Text: In order to avoid tripping the landmines, it is advised to not
   :    : run through the gym, or to bring a party member with 
   :    : Magnet Pull.
  @>Text: At the end, Lt. Surge will be blocked off by his trademark
   :    : electrified fencing.
  @>Text: Prospective challengers must disable the two generators 
   :    : that power the fencing before they can battle the Gym 
   :    : Leader.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Lt. Surge, though he makes his home in Kanto, was born 
   :    : and raised in the greater Unova Region.
  @>Text: He served in the Kanto Armed Forces during the Tohjo Civil War,
   :    : where he earned the nickname "The Lightning Unovan" for his
   :    : tactics involving Electric Pokémon.
  @>Text: After the gym was over, he was chosen as next in line to
   :    : serve as Vermilion City's Gym Leader when the previous one
   :    : stepped down.
  @>Text: Since then, Vermilion Gym has gained a reputation as being
   :    : effectively a boot camp in all but name.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch A == OFF
 @>Control Variables: [0124: Magnet Pull Steps] = 5
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Script: Input.trigger?(Input::ALT)
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0124: Magnet Pull Steps] < 1
  @>Text: Magnet Pull is currently in effect.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Else
  @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0124: Magnet Pull Steps] <= 5
   @>Text: Magnet Pull is currently recharging.
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Self Switch D == OFF
    @>Control Self Switch: D =ON
    @>Script: pbMagnetPull
    @>Script: Input.update
    @>Control Self Switch: D =OFF
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$player.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

 :    : as a something strange?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]No, but even then I wouldn't even know what to look for...
 :    : There were tabloid reports about unexplainable phenomena coming from
 :    : the Power Plant at night sometimes.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]However, having taken a look for myself, It could possibly
 :    : just be the cave not too far from the Plant.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Then yeah, I didn't see anything abnormal inside the
 :    : Power Plant.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Oh well! Fortunately, I had a few other leads worth
 :    : looking into!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]You see, while I was doing research into Kanto's history,
 :    : I came across two other interesting locations!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]The first one is Lavender Town, it's a place with a
 :    : strong affinity toward the supernatural.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Supposedly, there's a clan that resides there that has
 :    : resided in the Tohjo Continent for over 200 years.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]A clan that's in tune with the supernatural, huh?
 :    : It sounds like a good as lead as any!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Another place I learned of was Fuchsia City, where 
 :    : some ancient ruins were discovered not too long ago.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Ancient ruins? Was there any information about them?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Nope! Apparently people believed they were part of a 
 :    : place called the Safari Zone, but never opened to the public.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]They were found in close proximity to the facility, but
 :    : when the former Warden was asked about it, he had no clue what
 :    : they were talking about.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Initial research into the ruins show that they've
 :    : existed for several hundred years, and belonged to a clan
 :    : that existed in Kanto during that same time period.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Hmm... While it doesn't seem related on the surface, it's
 :    : hard to deny there could be a connection to the Sealed Realm.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I'm thinking the same thing... Actually, I was thinking about
 :    : heading over there to investigate them myself.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I'm not sure what it is, but something about them sticks out
 :    : to me.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Hm! So, shall I go hit up Lavender Town while you check out
 :    : those ruins?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]That sounds like a good idea to me! If one of us
 :    : finishes up first, then we can go meet up with the other to
 :    : help!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]You read my mind, Mary!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Well then, Lavender Town is just south of here, you have to
 :    : cross Rock Tunnel to get to it.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Meanwhile, I have to take the long and winding road
 :    : down Cycling Road to get to Fuchsia City... At least it'll be an
 :    : enjoyable downhill ride on a bike!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]You should probably hit the road right now then,
 :    : give yourself a good amount of time to get there and get
 :    : exploring!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I think I'll do just that! Good luck in Lavender Town,
 :    : Renko! Here's to hoping we finally find something!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Same to you, Mary!
@>Fade Out BGM: 4 sec.
@>Set Move Route: [Renko/Maribel]
 :              : $>Move Up
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left
 :              : $>Move Left

 :    : Kanto, I came across two other locations of interest.

 :    : the spiritual and supernatural.

 :    : back hundreds of years.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]That could work as a possible lead... if they've been 
 :    : around that long, then surely they must have some idea of 
 :    : what the Sealed Realm could be.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]I know, right? The other place is Fuchsia City, home 
 :    : of the Safari Zone- well, before it was closed down that is.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Apparently some time after the Safari Zone closed,
 :    : ancient ruins were found further into the Safari Zone's territory.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]At first it was believed that these ruins were made by
 :    : the Safari Zone Warden, but never opened to the public, but he
 :    : has no clue what those ruins even are.
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Preliminary research into them indicates that the ruins
 :    : belonged to an ancient clan that existed in Kanto several hundred
 :    : years ago.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Ancient ruins that haven't been touched for hundreds of years...
 :    : Even if they aren't related to the Sealed Realm, they could be interesting
 :    : all the same!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Call it a hunch, but I get the feeling those Ruins are definitely
 :    : tied to the Sealed Realm. I don't know how yet, but I'm willing to look into
 :    : it myself!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]So, you hit up Fuchsia City and I hit up Lavender Town?
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Sounds like a plan to me! You've got the quicker journey ahead
 :    : of you, Lavender Town is just past Rock Tunnel, right here on Route 10!
@>Text: \xn[Renko]Meanwhile, I need to detour all the way through Celadon
 :    : City to get to Fuchsia City. At least the trainers on Cycling Road
 :    : might make for a good training session for my partners!
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Perhaps if one of us finishes up before the other, we 
 :    : can meet back up with each other to lend our aid!

 :    : so I'll catch you later Mary!

 @>Script: Yuyuko = [:CYUYUKO, :YUYUKO, :AYUYUKO, :DYUYUKO]
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: Yuyuko.any? { |p| $player.first_pokemon.isSpecies?(p) }
  @>Show Animation: Player, [Question bubble]
  @>Text: Oh, the Yuyuko in your party seems to want to touch the tree.
  @>Text: Let it?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Fade Out BGM: 5 sec.
   @>Set Move Route: Player
    :              : $>Direction Fix ON
    :              : $>Move Down
    :              : $>Direction Fix OFF
   @>Wait for Move's Completion
   @>Wait: 10 frame(s)

   @>Set Move Route: [Yuyuko]
    :              : $>Through ON
    :              : $>Change Opacity: 255
    :              : $>Move Up
    :              : $>Through OFF
    :              : $>Wait: 20 frame(s)
    :              : $>Script: Pokemon.play_cry(:CYUYUKO)
    :              : $>Jump: +0,+0
    :              : $>Wait: 4 frame(s)
    :              : $>Jump: +0,+0
   @>Wait for Move's Completion
   @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(2,"A",true)
   @>Wait: 40 frame(s)
   @>Set Weather Effects: None, @80
   @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
   @>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
   @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
   @>Play SE: 'Vs flash', 80, 100
   @>Wait: 30 frame(s)
   @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
   @>Play SE: 'Vs flash', 80, 100

Event ID: 007
Event Name: EV007
(X,Y): (016,011)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: DJ Naki is a Morning only Event. The player can talk to them 
 :       : every day and get "interviewed". This segment is just a small 
 :       : questionare which gets you Points you can exchange for items.
 :       : 
 :       : Similar to Buena's Password.
@>Comment: The main portion of DJ Naki's interview is the Battle Segment
 :       : where she battles you live on radio. If you beat her, she gives
 :       : you a greater amount of Points.
 :       : 
 :       : Her team scales based on badge count.
@>Comment: There will be a counter that tracks how many times the player 
 :       : has  battled DJ Naki. There might be a dedicated one for 
 :       : victories, but I'm not settled on that yet.
 :       : 
 :       : This variable controls her dialogue to an extent, as well as 
 :       : prizes you recieve.
@>Comment: At certain victory thresholds, the player will recieve items from 
 :       : DJ Naki. The items and thresholds are as follows:
 :       : 5 Wins: 
 :       : 10 Wins:
 :       : 25 Wins:
 :       : 50 Wins:
@>Comment: 100 Wins: Prism Candy, Crimson Jam x5
 :       : 
 :       : At every win past 100 she gives the player an additional 10
 :       : Points, plus 
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 010
Event Name: Name Rater
(X,Y): (043,004)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 10

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \bHello, hello!\nI am the official Name Rater!
@>Text: \bWant me to rate the nicknames of your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \bWhich Pokémon's nickname should I critique?
 @>Comment: Opens a screen for choosing a Pokémon. The index 
  :       : is stored in Game Variable 1, and the name in Game 
  :       : Variable 3.
 @>Script: pbChoosePokemon(1, 3)
 @>Comment: If Game Variable 1 is less than 0, it means the player 
  :       : has canceled choosing a Pokémon.
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
  @>Text: \bI see.\nDo come visit again.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Comment: Check for eggs.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).egg?
  @>Text: \bNow, now... That is merely an Egg!
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Comment: Check for Shadow Pokémon.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).shadowPokemon?
  @>Text: \bI wouldn't dare critique a Shadow Pokémon's name!
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).foreign?($player)
  @>Text: \bHmmm... \v[3] it is!
  @>Text: \bThis is a magnificent nickname! It is impeccably 
   :    : beyond reproach!
  @>Text: \bYou'll do well to cherish your \v[3] now and 
   :    : beyond.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: \b\v[3], is it?\nThat is a decent nickname!
 @>Text: \bBut, would you like me to give it a nicer name?
 @>Text: \bHow about it?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Text: \bAh, good. Then, what shall the new nickname be?
  @>Script: pkmn = pbGetPokemon(1)
  :       : species = pkmn.speciesName
  :       : pbSet(4, species)
  :       : pbTextEntry("#{species}'s nickname?",
  :       :   0, Pokemon::MAX_NAME_SIZE, 5)
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(5) == pbGet(3) || (pbGet(5) == "" && pbGet(3) == pbGet(4))
   @>Comment: The Pokémon's nickname wasn't changed.
   @>Text: \bI see. You're right, there's no need to change this 
    :    : Pokémon's nickname.
   @>Text: \bIt already had a superb name!
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(5) == "" || pbGet(5) == pbGet(4)
    @>Comment: Resets the Pokémon's nickname to the species name.
    @>Script: pkmn = pbGetPokemon(1)
    :       : pkmn.name = nil
    :       : pbSet(3, pkmn.name)
    @>Text: \bDone! From now on, this Pokémon shall be known
     :    : as \v[3]!
    @>Text: \bIt looks no different from before, and yet, this is 
     :    : vastly superior!
    @>Text: \bHow fortunate for you!
    @>
   : Else
    @>Comment: Retrieves the Pokémon whose party index is stored in 
     :       : Game Variable 1, and changes its name to the name 
     :       : stored in Game Variable 5.
    @>Script: pkmn = pbGetPokemon(1)
    :       : pkmn.name = pbGet(5)
    @>Text: \bDone! From now on, this Pokémon shall be known
     :    : as \v[5]!
    @>Text: \bIt is a better name than before!\nHow fortunate for 
     :    : you!
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>Text: \bI see.\nDo come visit again.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \bI see.\nDo come visit again.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$player.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

Event ID: 003
Event Name: EV003
(X,Y): (099,008)

Page #1
Conditions

Graphic: trainer_CHANELLER

Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

@>Script: pbTrainerIntro(:ELDERPRIESTESS)
@>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Hmph! Come, child! Let me show you what the
 :    : descendant of the great and venerable Hakurei Clan is capable
 :    : of!
@>Change Battle BGM: 'B-022. Demystify Feast', 100, 100
@>Comment: EndSpeech: Perhaps this is how it was meant to be.
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:ELDERPRIESTESS, "Angela")
 @>Play BGM: 'W-023. Pokemon Tower', 100, 100
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]It would seem the gods have favored you 
  :    : today, Miss \pn.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]I take it that means you'll tell me all that you know?
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Under normal circumstances, I would shoo you 
  :    : out of the Tower without a second thought, however...
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]There's... something about you. You claim to 
  :    : be normal, but I believe otherwise.
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I don't know what it is, but... Perhaps we can
  :    : trust you with the knowledge.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]\b(Finally, progress!)
 @>Text: Lady Angela, are you sure that is a good idea? Just giving away
  :    : your clan's ancient heritage to a stranger?
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]As I said, I believe this person is trustworthy
  :    : enough. I could gather as such through our battle.
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Besides... The Hakurei Clan is all but forgotten
  :    : to time. None are left alive to remember or acknowledge our 
  :    : lineage.
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I have to wonder if the other side's clan is still
  :    : holding up...
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]Hmph! At any rate, Miss \pn?
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Yes? What is it?
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I will ask you to wait in my office, just next to
  :    : the archives, while I look for the relevant tomes we have.
 @>Text: \xn[Head Priestess]I cannot promise it'll be much. Most of my
  :    : clan's tomes were lost when they moved from their ancestral
  :    : home.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Oh, no, don't worry! Anything you have will be helpful!
  :    : I'll be taking my leave now!
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch2(259,3,"A",true)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch2(259,7,"B",true)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch2(259,8,"A",true)
 @>Control Self Switch: B =ON
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 80, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[259: Lavender Tower], (007,041), Up, No Fade
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions

Freq: 3: Low

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 007
Event Name: DLwRuukoto
(X,Y): (018,012)

Page #1
Conditions
Self Switch A is ON

Graphic: trainer_HAYWIRE2

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Hm? Is there something you need from me?
@>Show Choices: Who are you?, Who is your master?, Why are you doing this?, Nothing
(When Cancel: Choice 4)
: When [Who are you?]
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Who am I? I mentioned earlier, I am Dark
  :    : Last Word Ruukoto! I am the enforcer of my Master's will.
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]It is my job to clean up messes too filthy for 
  :    : him to handle alone.
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Once all vice has been purged from the 
  :    : world, only then will it be truly clean!
 @>
: When [Who is your master?]
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]You need not concern yourself with that right
  :    : now! You might even meet him if you do your job well enough!
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Who knows, perhaps you've already met him at
  :    : some point? Wouldn't that be exciting, to be in the presence of 
  :    : my Master and not even know it!
 @>
: When [Why are you doing this?]
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Silph Co. stole my Master's precious work and
  :    : didn't even think of crediting him properly! How repulsive of 
  :    : them!
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]He poured his heart and soul into his work, 
  :    : only to be disgraced by this company. 
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]However, he's never been one to be idle, 
  :    : and he will get what rightfully belongs to him.\wt[20] Credit 
  :    : and recognition for his hard work!
 @>
: When [Nothing]
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Then I suggest you get back to work! Good 
  :    : luck, miss!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Variable 0126: T.U.C.: Ruukoto SQ is 6 or above

Graphic: trainer_HAYWIRE2

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]You've returned, and we all had a splendid time
 :    : watching your exploits!
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]How did we watch? Why, I had the cameras
 :    : focused on you the entire time!
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]My Master and I have gathered all the necessary
 :    : information we needed from these exhibition matches! We thank
 :    : you for your support.
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]However, your task is not done yet.
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]You do remember, of course, that there were
 :    : <i>five</i> PokéPuppets, yes? And you only fought four of my
 :    : sisters.
@>Script: pbTrainerIntro(:HAYWIRE2)
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Surely you understand what this means, yes?\wt[15]
 :    : Precisely! I'm your final opponent!
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]My Master has given me the tools I need to
 :    : suceed in any combat environment, but let's do our best now!
 :    : He will be watching us, after all!
@>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Prepare for my Master's deserved Retribution!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 10
@>Control Variables: [0104: Vs. Transition - Pkmn] = 5
@>Change Battle BGM: 'B-023. Strawberry Crisis', 100, 100
@>Comment: EndSpeech: Oh my, the Dark Metamorphosis failed!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:HAYWIRE2, "Ruukoto")
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]My word, you even stood up to the Dark 
  :    : Metamorphosis! You are quite the trainer!
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]It would appear that my Master is satisfied
  :    : with the results of today's exhibition. You have played your
  :    : part to perfection Miss...
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Oh, I don't believe I ever caught your name!
  :    : Where are my manners!
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Your name is \pn, I shall commit it to memory!
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Well then \pn, as thanks for your service
  :    : today, there is something my Master would like to reward you 
  :    : with.
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Please commit this code to memory, it shall be 
  :    : useful later.
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]\rControl Variables: [0126: T.U.C.: Ruukoto SQ] += 1
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Wait, you can't do anything with that? Please
  :    : hold a moment!
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Here you go! Just type <c2=65467b14>23112013</c2> into
  :    : any terminal inside a Pokémon Center!
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]For now, I must be going, before the "Corporate
  :    : Bastards" try and take me for their nefarious purposes.
 @>Set Move Route: [DLwRuukoto]
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]You are all dismissed now! Please travel safely!
  :    : You may pick up pamphlets on your way out!
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Now if you'll excuse me...
 @>Play SE: 'PC access', 80, 100
 @>Text: \xn[DLwRuukoto]Sisters, I believe it is time to return to base!
  :    : Activating teleporter module now!
 @>Play SE: 'Teleport', 80, 100
 @>Wait: 4 frame(s)
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>Script: deactivateSpecialBGM("Retribution")
 @>Control Variables: [0126: T.U.C.: Ruukoto SQ] += 1
 @>Transfer Player:[263: Silph Co.: Presentation Room], (019,012), Left, No Fade
 @>Set Event Location: [Scientist Presenter],(008,012), Right
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>Play SE: 'teleporter', 80, 100
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]Hold just a second please!
 @>Set Move Route: [Scientist Presenter]
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]On behalf of Silph Co., I am extremely 
  :    : sorry for what you had to go through.
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]This... wasn't entirely unexpected, but 
  :    : we never actually expected them to go through with it.
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]The situation is a bit messier than it
  :    : was made out to be. I'm... not at complete liberty to disclose
  :    : all the details.
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]For now, please take this as compensation
  :    : for your time.
 @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:KNOWLEDGESPHERE)
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]This sphere seems to be part of a set, 
  :    : but beyond that we don't know much about it.
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]It helped us considerably during our
  :    : creation of the PokéPuppets, but it would be much better off
  :    : in your hands.
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]And uh... If you happen to see that
  :    : Ruukoto's master, tell them that I'll try and resolve this 
  :    : situation on their behalf.
 @>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]Stay safe, miss, and good luck on
  :    : your journey.
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[247: Silph Co.], (018,004), Down, No Fade
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>Script: advanceQuestToStage(:Quest107, 3)
 @>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
 @>
: Branch End
@>Set Move Route: [DLwRuukoto]
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Script: pbTrainerEnd
@>

@>Text: \xn[P.A. System]Will all guests please take their seats now, the
 :    : presentation is about to begin.
@>Script: move_to_location($game_player, 15, 30, true)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Set Move Route: Player
 :              : $>Turn Up
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-85,-85,-50,0), @20
@>Scroll Map: Right, 3, 3
@>Scroll Map: Up, 19, 3
@>Set Event Location: [Scientist Presenter],(006,012)
@>Set Event Location: [DLwRuukoto],(008,044)
@>Set Move Route: [Scientist Presenter]
 :              : $>Wait: 35 frame(s)
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Move Right
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]Greetings distinguished guests, and 
 :    : welcome to a very special showcase of Silph Co.'s latest 
 :    : creation!
@>Text: \xn[Silph Co. Scientist]Ten years ago, we shook the world by
 :    : introducing our very first Synthetic Pokémon, Porygon, and
 :    : three years later we shook it further by upgrading it with
 :    : an evolution.
@>Set Move Route: [Scientist Presenter]

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$player.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

$>Turn at Random

Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 5: Higher
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Memorize BGM/BGS
@>Script: pbTrainerIntro(:SCMary)
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]\pn, you're here! Just in time, too. Something weird is
 :    : going on.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I've been trying to investigate the Safari Zone, but my
 :    : attempts to do so have been met with a brick wall.
@>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]A guard has been stationed there, saying they're doing
 :    : "renovations", then pointed to the giant red "R" on their shirt saying
 :    : they're part of the renovation crew.
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]Wait, you say that that's the uniform of Team Rocket!?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I guess it makes sense why I didn't recognize it, since I
 :    : never saw them...
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]But if that's the case, what are they doing at the Safari
 :    : Zone?
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I really don't like the way this is shaping up... \pn, we 
 :    : should do something about this.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]I get the feeling that we'll need to be at the top of our
 :    : game if we want to deal with Team Rocket.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]What do you say to a quick spar before we get going.
 :    : From the looks of things, Team Rocket hasn't found what they're
 :    : after yet, so we probably have time.
@>Text: \xn[Maribel]What do you think, \pn? Do you wanna have a quick match
 :    : or get going right away?
@>Show Choices: A quick match shouldn't hurt, There's no time to waste!
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [A quick match shouldn't hurt]
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Alright, let's do this \pn!
 @>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
 @>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 2
 @>Control Variables: [0104: Vs. Transition - Pkmn] = 5
 @>Control Variables: [0115: Vs. Transition - Background] = 3
 @>Comment: EndSpeech: Maribel: I think that did the trick!
 @>Script: setBattleRule("canLose")
 :       : setBattleRule("backdrop", "indoor7")
 :       : setBattleRule("base", "yellow1")
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:SCMary, "Maribel", pbGet(7)+9)
  @>
 : Else
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Comment: ================================
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1
  @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Looks like it's your win here, \pn!
  @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Maybe while we're tackling Team Rocket, I'll pick
   :    : up some new techniques...
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Looks like it's my win this time, \pn!
  @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I guess I've improved a lot since our last battle
   :    : in Vermilion!
  @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I definitely feel confident I can tackle Team Rocket
   :    : after that!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Speaking of which, we should head out and see
  :    : what's going on at the Safari Zone now!
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]I'll meet you over there, \pn!
 @>
: When [There's no time to waste!]
 @>Text: \xn[Maribel]Then let's get going! I'll meet you at the Safari Zone!
 @>
: Branch End
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Play SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 8 frame(s)
@>Control Self Switch: B =ON
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
@>Restore BGM/BGS
@>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] = 12
@>Script: advanceQuestToStage(:Quest22, 2)
@>

 :              : $>Through OFF
 :              : $>Always on Top OFF

@>Transfer Player:[271: Gatehouse], (009,010), Left, No Fade
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6

  :       : pkmn.iv[:SPEED]           = 25

  :    : were we surprised!

 @>Text: We don't know how it got there, but your Pokémon

  @>
 : Branch End
 @>

 : Branch End

  :       : DayCare.get_details(1,4,-1)
  :       : DayCare.get_compatibility(5)

    :    : each other...

 :       : has canceled choosing a Pokémon.

:       :        !poke.egg?},true)
@>Comment: If variable 1 is less than 0, it means the player has 
 :       : canceled choosing a Pokémon.
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
 @>Text: \bCome back if you want to train.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).egg?
  @>Text: \bAn egg can't be trained.
  @>Jump to Label: ChoosePokemon
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).shadowPokemon?
  @>Text: \bNo way, I don't want to go near a Shadow 
   :    : Pokémon..
  @>Jump to Label: ChoosePokemon
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Label: stat
 @>Text: \bWhich stat do you want to train?
 @>Text: \ch[26,-1,HP,ATK,DEF,SPE ATK,SPE DEF,SPEED]
 @>Script: pkmn = pbGetPokemon(1)
 :       : value = 0
 :       : params = ChooseNumberParams.new
 :       : params.setDefaultValue(value)
 :       : params.setMaxDigits(3)
 :       : params.setNegativesAllowed(false)
 :       : value = pbMessageChooseNumber(_INTL("How much eV do you want?",27),params)
 :       : pbJustRaiseEffortValues(pkmn,pbGet(26),value)
 :       : pkmn.calc_stats
 :       :  
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Show Choices: Choose another stat, Change Pokémon, Stop!
 (When Cancel: Choice 3)
 : When [Choose another stat]
  @>Jump to Label: stat
  @>
 : When [Change Pokémon]
  @>Jump to Label: ChoosePokemon
  @>
 : When [Stop!]
  @>Text: \bCome back if you want to train.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle

 :       : luck in future.
