Event ID: 009
Event Name: Vending machine 1
(X,Y): (128,006)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Up
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: It's a vending machine.\n
  :    : Which drink would you like?\G
 @>Show Choices: Fresh Water - $200, Soda Pop - $300, Lemonade - $350, Cancel
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Fresh Water - $200]
  @>Conditional Branch: Gold 200 or more
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(:FRESHWATER)
    @>Change Gold: - 200
    @>Script: $bag.add(:FRESHWATER)
    @>Text: \GA Fresh Water dropped down!
    @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = Random No. (0...10)
    @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
     @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(:FRESHWATER)
      @>Script: $bag.add(:FRESHWATER)
      @>Text: \GBonus! Another Fresh Water dropped down.
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>Jump to Label: Start
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: \GYou have no room left in the Bag.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: \GYou don't have enough money.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [Soda Pop - $300]
  @>Conditional Branch: Gold 300 or more
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(:SODAPOP)
    @>Change Gold: - 300
    @>Script: $bag.add(:SODAPOP)
    @>Text: \GA Soda Pop dropped down!
    @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = Random No. (0...10)
    @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
     @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(:SODAPOP)
      @>Script: $bag.add(:SODAPOP)
      @>Text: \GBonus! Another Soda Pop dropped down.
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>Jump to Label: Start
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: \GYou have no room left in the Bag.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: \GYou don't have enough money.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [Lemonade - $350]
  @>Conditional Branch: Gold 350 or more
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(:LEMONADE)
    @>Change Gold: - 350
    @>Script: $bag.add(:LEMONADE)
    @>Text: \GA Lemonade dropped down!
    @>Control Variables: [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] = Random No. (0...10)
    @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
     @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(:LEMONADE)
      @>Script: $bag.add(:LEMONADE)
      @>Text: \GBonus! Another Lemonade dropped down.
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>Jump to Label: Start
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: \GYou have no room left in the Bag.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: \GYou don't have enough money.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [Cancel]
  @>Text: \GDecided not to buy a drink.
  @>
 : Branch End

: Else

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 012
Event Name: EV012
(X,Y): (016,009)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 22

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Would you like an explanation of how the Pokémon World 
 :    : Tournament works?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Here in the Pokémon World Tournament, you select a specific 
  :    : tournament to take part in. 
 @>Text: Each tournament consists of three rounds. If you clear all
  :    : three rounds you are awarded with Battle Points.
 @>Text: The amount of Battle Points you earn for winning is dependant
  :    : on the relevant tournament and your win streak within that
  :    : tournament.
 @>Text: Each tournament is broken into different challenge modes.
 @>Text: Singles, which allows you to take 3 Pokémon into a one on one
  :    : battle against the other trainers.
 @>Text: Doubles, which allows you to take 4 Pokémon into a two on two
  :    : battle against the other trainers.
 @>Text: Full, which allows you to take all of your Pokémon into a one on one
  :    : battle against the other trainers.
 @>Text: And Sudden Death, where you may only bring in one Pokémon to battle
  :    : against each trainer.
 @>Text: And finally, money and experience is not gained while in a tournament.
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: If you ever need a reminder of how the tournaments work, I'm
  :    : always here to help!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 019
Event Name: Coin seller
(X,Y): (004,002)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 07

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \G\CN\bWelcome to Rocket Game Corner!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: !$bag.has?(:COINCASE)
 @>Text: \G\CN\bDo you need some game coins?\nWould you 
  :    : like to buy some?
 @>Text: \G\CN\bYou don't have a Coin Case.
 @>
: Else
 @>Label: Start menu
 @>Text: \G\CN\bDo you need some game coins?\nWould you 
  :    : like to buy some?
 @>Show Choices: 50 coins [$1,000], 500 coins [$10,000], Exit
 (When Cancel: Choice 3)
 : When [50 coins [$1,000]]
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: $player.coins + 50 >= Settings::MAX_COINS
   @>Text: \G\CN\bWhoops!\nYour Coin Case is full.
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Gold 999 or less
    @>Text: \G\CN\bYou can't afford the coins.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Change Gold: - 1000
    @>Script: $player.coins += 50
    @>Text: \G\CN\bThank you\nHere are your coins!
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [500 coins [$10,000]]
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: $player.coins + 500 >= Settings::MAX_COINS
   @>Text: \G\CN\bWhoops!\nYour Coin Case is full.
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Gold 9999 or less
    @>Text: \G\CN\bYou can't afford the coins.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Change Gold: - 10000
    @>Script: $player.coins += 500
    @>Text: \G\CN\bThank you\nHere are your coins!
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [Exit]
  @>Text: \G\CN\bNo?\nPlease come play sometime!
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>Jump to Label: Start menu
@>

:       :       :GOTHIC,:SWIMSUIT,
:       :       :YELLOWFLUTE,0][pbGet(1)]

:       :       ][pbGet(1)]

:       : end

:       : pbSet(3,PBItems.getName(item))

   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(pbGet(1))
    @>Script: $PokemonGlobal.coins-=pbGet(2)
    @>Script: pbReceiveItem(pbGet(1))
    @>
   : Else

    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>
 : Branch End

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 001
Event Name: Day Care Lady
(X,Y): (015,005)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 11

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Script: DayCare.egg_generated?
 @>Text: Ah, there you are!  My husband was looking for 
  :    : you.
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>Control Self Switch: A =OFF
@>Conditional Branch: Script: DayCare.count==0
 @>Text: I'm the Day-Care Lady.  We can raise Pokémon for 
  :    : you.
 @>Text: Would you like us to raise your Pokémon?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: $player.pokemonCount<=1
   @>Text: Oh?  But you only have one Pokémon with you.
   @>Text: You can't go off without a Pokémon.  Come back 
    :    : another time.
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Text: Which Pokémon should we raise for you?
  @>Script: pbChooseNonEggPokemon(1,3)
  @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
   @>Text: Oh, fine, then.\nCome again.
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: !$player.has_other_able_pokemon?(pbGet(1))
   @>Text: If you leave me that Pokémon, what are you gonna 
    :    : battle with?
   @>Text: Come back another time.
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Script: DayCare.deposit(pbGet(1))
  @>Text: Fine, we'll raise your \v[3] for a while.
  @>Text: Come back for it later.
  @>Label: RaiseAnother
  @>Text: We can raise two of your Pokémon.  Would you like 
   :    : us to raise another?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $player.pokemonCount<=1
    @>Text: Oh?  But you only have one Pokémon with you.
    @>Text: You can't go off without a Pokémon.  Come back 
     :    : another time.
    @>Exit Event Processing
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Text: Which Pokémon should we raise for you?
   @>Script: pbChooseNonEggPokemon(1,3)
   @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
    @>Text: Very good.  Come again.
    @>Exit Event Processing
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: !$player.has_other_able_pokemon?(pbGet(1))
    @>Text: If you leave me that Pokémon, what are you gonna 
     :    : battle with?
    @>Text: Come back another time.
    @>Exit Event Processing
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Script: DayCare.deposit(pbGet(1))
   @>Text: Fine, we'll raise your \v[3] for a while.
   @>Text: Come back for it later.
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Conditional Branch: Self Switch A == ON
    @>Jump to Label: TakeBack
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: Very good.  Come again.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>Text: Oh, fine, then.\nCome again.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Text: Ah, it's you!  Good to see you.  Now, about your 
  :    : Pokémon...
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: DayCare.get_level_gain(0,3,4) && $game_variables[4]>0
  @>Text: By level, your \v[3] has grown by about \v[4].
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: DayCare.get_level_gain(1,3,4) && $game_variables[4]>0
  @>Text: By level, your \v[3] has grown by about \v[4].
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: DayCare.count==1
  @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
  @>Jump to Label: RaiseAnother
  @>
 : Else
  @>Label: TakeBack
  @>Text: Do you want your Pokémon back?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Label: TakeBackChosen
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $player.party.length>=6
    @>Text: Your Pokémon team is full.  Make room, then come 
     :    : see me.
    @>Exit Event Processing
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Script: DayCare.choose(
   :       : _I("Which one do you want back?"),1)
   @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
    @>Text: Very good.  Come again.
    @>Exit Event Processing
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Script: DayCare.get_details(pbGet(1),3,4)
   @>Text: \GIf you want your \v[3] back, it will cost $\v[4].
   @>Show Choices: Yes, No
   (When Cancel: Choice 2)
   : When [Yes]
    @>Control Variables: [0005: Temp Text Entry] = Gold
    @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0005: Temp Text Entry] < Variable [0004: Temp Move Name]
     @>Text: \GYou don't have enough money...
     @>Exit Event Processing
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>Change Gold: - Variable [0004: Temp Move Name]
    @>Script: DayCare.withdraw(pbGet(1))
    @>Text: \GExcellent\nHere's your Pokémon.
    @>Text: \PN took \v[3] back from the Day-Care Lady.
    @>Conditional Branch: Script: DayCare.count==1
     @>Text: Do you want to take back the other one, too?
     @>Show Choices: Yes, No
     (When Cancel: Choice 2)
     : When [Yes]
      @>Jump to Label: TakeBackChosen
      @>
     : When [No]
      @>Text: Very good.  Come again.
      @>
     : Branch End
     @>
    : Else
     @>Text: Very good.  Come again.
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : When [No]
    @>Text: Very good.  Come again.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Text: Very good.  Come again.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

@>Text: Greetings traveler, and welcome to my shop.
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch A == OFF
 @>Text: I sell specialty charms and amulets here that will keep you
  :    : and your most cherished partners safe.
 @>Text: Everything you see here is hand crafted by myself.
 @>Text: While I am amenable to you purchasing my stock, do note that
  :    : it comes at a high price. I take great pride in my work, and the
  :    : money goes toward bulk purchasing the ingredients I need.

  :    : that would be a different story entirely, and I'll do it all for free.

Event ID: 004
Event Name: EV004
(X,Y): (001,015)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Left
 @>Text: Welcome to the Automated Coin Dealing Machine.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.quantity(PBItems::COINCASE)<=0
  @>Text: \G\CN\bWould you like to purchase some coins?
  @>Text: \G\CN\bIn order to purchase coins, you must have a 
   :    : coin case. Please return with one.
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \G\CN\bWould you like to purchase some coins?
  @>Show Choices: 50 coins [$1,000], 500 coins [$10,000], Exit
  (When Cancel: Choice 3)
  : When [50 coins [$1,000]]
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonGlobal.coins+50>=MAXCOINS
    @>Text: \G\CN\bYour coin case is full. Please use your coins 
     :    : at any of the machines on this floor.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Conditional Branch: Gold 999 or less
     @>Text: \G\CN\bYou can't afford the coins.
     @>
    : Else
     @>Change Gold: - 1000
     @>Script: $PokemonGlobal.coins+=50
     @>Text: \G\CN\bThank you\nDispensing coins now.
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : When [500 coins [$10,000]]
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $PokemonGlobal.coins+500>=MAXCOINS
    @>Text: \G\CN\bYour coin case is full. Please use your coins 
     :    : at any of the machines on this floor.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Conditional Branch: Gold 9999 or less
     @>Text: \G\CN\bYou can't afford the coins.
     @>
    : Else
     @>Change Gold: - 10000
     @>Script: $PokemonGlobal.coins+=500
     @>Text: \G\CN\bThank you\nDispensing coins now.
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : When [Exit]
   @>Text: \G\CN\bIf you require no other service, please step 
    :    : away from the machine.
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Text: A sign on the side of the machine reads:
 @>Text: Please approach the machine from the front. Thank 
  :    : you.\n-Celadon City Game Corner
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 040
Event Name: Prize vendor left
(X,Y): (002,024)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 07

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \CNWe exchange your coins for items down here.
@>Text: \CNSee anything you like?\ch[1,10,Magmarizer - 4000 Coins,
 :    : Electirizer - 4000 Coins,Razor Claw - 4000 Coins,Razor Fang - 4000 Coins,
 :    : Reaper Cloth - 4000 Coins,Dragon Scale - 4000 Coins,Metal Coat - 4000 Coins,
 :    : Protector - 4000 Coins,Prism Scale - 4000 Coins,No thanks]
@>Script: item=[:MAGMARIZER,:ELECTIRIZER,:RAZORCLAW,
:       :       :RAZORFANG,:REAPERCLOTH,:DRAGONSCALE,
:       :       :METALCOAT,:PROTECTOR,:PRISMSCALE,0][pbGet(1)]
:       : price=[4000,4000,4000,4000,4000,4000,4000,4000,4000,0
:       :       ][pbGet(1)]
:       : pbSet(1, item)
:       : pbSet(2, price)
:       : if item
:       :   data = GameData::Item.get(item)
:       :   pbSet(3, data.name)
:       : end
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] > 0
 @>Text: \CNSo, you want the \v[3]?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(2) > $player.coins
   @>Text: \CNSorry, you'll need more coins than that.
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.can_add?(pbGet(1))
    @>Script: $player.coins -= pbGet(2)
    @>Script: pbReceiveItem(pbGet(1))
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: \CNYou have no room in your Bag.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 001
Event Name: Poison+Dark
(X,Y): (004,003)

Page #1
Conditions
Switch 0134:  is ON

Graphic: NPC 07

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \CNWe exchange your coins for Pokémon down here. 
 :    : Which set would you like to choose from?
@>Label: Type Select
@>Show Choices: Poison Pokémon, Dark Pokémon, No Thanks
(When Cancel: Choice 3)
: When [Poison Pokémon]
 @>Text: \CNPoison Pokémon, alright! Here's what you can choose 
  :    : from.\ch[1,-1,Ekans - 500 Coins,Gulpin - 500 Coins,
  :    : Qwilfish - 1500 Coins,Seviper - 1500 Coins,
  :    : Drapion - 3000 Coins,No thanks]
 @>Script: item=[:EKANS,:GULPIN,:QWILFISH,
 :       :       :SEVIPER,:DRAPION,0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : price=[500,500,1000,1500,3000,
 :       :        0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : lv=[10,10,25,25,40,0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : pbSet(1, item)
 :       : pbSet(2, price)
 :       : if item
 :       :   data = GameData::Species.get(item)
 :       :   pbSet(3, data.name)
 :       : end
 :       : pbSet(4, lv)
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0002: Temp Move Choice] > 0
  @>Text: \CNSo, you want the \v[3]?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(2)>$player.coins
    @>Text: \CNSorry, you'll need more coins than that.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbAddPokemon(pbGet(1), pbGet(4))
     @>Script: $player.coins -= pbGet(2)
     @>Text: Would you like anything else?
     @>Jump to Label: Type Select
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright! Come back
    :    : again anytime!
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright! Come back
    :    : again anytime!
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [Dark Pokémon]
 @>Text: \CNDark Pokémon, alright! Here's what you can choose 
  :    : from.\ch[1,-1,Murkrow - 500 Coins,Poochyena - 500 Coins,
  :    : Sharpedo - 1500 Coins,Stunky - 1500 Coins,
  :    : Absol - 3000 Coins,No thanks]
 @>Script: item=[:MURKROW,:POOCHYENA,:SHARPEDO,
 :       :       :STUNKY,:ABSOL,0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : price=[500,500,1500,1500,3000,
 :       :        0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : lv=[15,10,20,20,30,0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : pbSet(1, item)
 :       : pbSet(2, price)
 :       : if item
 :       :   data = GameData::Species.get(item)
 :       :   pbSet(3, data.name)
 :       : end
 :       : pbSet(4, lv)
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0002: Temp Move Choice] > 0
  @>Text: \CNSo, you want the \v[3]?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(2)>$player.coins
    @>Text: \CNSorry, you'll need more coins than that.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbAddPokemon(pbGet(1), pbGet(4))
     @>Script: $player.coins -= pbGet(2)
     @>Text: Would you like anything else?
     @>Jump to Label: Type Select
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright! Come back
    :    : again anytime!
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright! Come back
    :    : again anytime!
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No Thanks]
 @>Text: Alright, come again sometime!
 @>

  :    : Tyrogue - 3000 Coins,No thanks]
 @>Script: item=[:CROAGUNK,:MEDITITE,:HERACROSS,
 :       :       :PRIMEAPE,:TYROGUE,0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : price=[500,500,1500,1500,3000,
 :       :        0][pbGet(1)]
 :       : lv=[10,10,25,30,5,0][pbGet(1)]

 :       : pbSet(2, price)

 :       :   pbSet(3, data.name)
 :       : end
 :       : pbSet(4, lv)

  @>Text: \CNSo, you want the \v[3]?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(2)>$player.coins
    @>Text: \CNSorry, you'll need more coins than that.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbAddPokemon(pbGet(1), pbGet(4))
     @>Script: $player.coins -= pbGet(2)
     @>Text: Would you like anything else?
     @>Jump to Label: Type Select
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright! Come back
    :    : again anytime!

    :    : again anytime!

    @>Text: \CNSorry, you'll need more coins than that.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbAddPokemon(pbGet(1), pbGet(4))
     @>Script: $player.coins -= pbGet(2)
     @>Text: Would you like anything else?
     @>Jump to Label: Type Select
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright! Come back
    :    : again anytime!
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright! Come back
    :    : again anytime!
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No Thanks]
 @>Text: Alright, come again sometime!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

:       :       :ALTARIA,:BAGON,0][pbGet(1)]

@>Text: \CNHere you can exchange your coins for special 
 :    : Pokémon. Take note, these Pokémon come at a much 
 :    : higher price than other vendors for special reasons.
@>Text: \CNWhich group would you like to choose from?\ch[1,5,
 :    : Frenzy Plant - Grass,Hydro Cannon - Water,
 :    : Blast Burn - Fire,Volt Tackle - Pikachu (15000 Coins),
 :    : No thanks]
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
 @>Comment: Frenzy Plant
 @>Text: \CNFrenzy Plant, understood! From this category
  :    : you can redeem your coins for the following.\ch[1,5,
  :    : Bulbasaur - 20000 Coins,Chikorita - 20000 Coins,
  :    : Treecko - 20000 Coins,Turtwig - 20000 Coins,No thanks]
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
  @>Comment: Bulbasaur
  @>Text: \CNJust making sure, Bulbasaur is what you want?
  @>Show Choices: Yes, No
  (When Cancel: Choice 2)
  : When [Yes]
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: 20000>$PokemonGlobal.coins
    @>Text: \CNSorry, you'll need more coins than that.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Conditional Branch: Script: !pbBoxesFull?
     @>Script: p=PokeBattle_Pokemon.new(:BULBASAUR,15,$player)
     :       : p.calc_stats
     :       : pbAutoLearnMove(p,:FRENZYPLANT)
     :       : pbAutoLearnMove(p,:LEECHSEED)
     :       : pbAutoLearnMove(p,:TAKEDOWN)
     :       : pbAutoLearnMove(p,:SLEEPPOWDER)
     :       : 
     :       : pbAddPokemon(p)
     @>Script: $PokemonGlobal.coins-=20000
     @>Text: Enjoy your new Pokemon, take good care of it!
     @>Exit Event Processing
     @>
    : Else
     @>Text: There's no more room for Pokemon!
     @>Text: Your entire PC is full and can't accept any more!
     @>Jump to Label: Ending
     @>
    : Branch End
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : When [No]
   @>Text: Changed your mind? Alright, come back any time!
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 001
Event Name: Triple Triad explainer
(X,Y): (003,003)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 08

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: I'm here to explain the rules of Triple Triad.
@>Label: Choices
@>Text: Which topic do you want to learn about?
@>Show Choices: Basics, Game rules, Prizes, Exit
(When Cancel: Choice 4)
: When [Basics]
 @>Text: Triple Triad is a game played with special square 
  :    : cards placed on a 3x3 board.
 @>Text: Each card has 4 numbers on it, one per side.  
  :    : These numbers are so-called stats.
 @>Text: Players take turns placing cards on the board.  As 
  :    : they do so, they try to capture and gain control of 
  :    : their opponent's cards.
 @>Text: That's where the numbers come in.  If a player 
  :    : places a card with a higher number next to a card 
  :    : with a lower number, the player captures that card.
 @>Text: Thus, the goal of the game is to gain control of more 
  :    : cards than the other player by the end of the game.
 @>Jump to Label: Choices
 @>
: When [Game rules]
 @>Text: There are a number of optional game rules you can 
  :    : apply to individual games.
 @>Text: They can affect card stats, how cards capture 
  :    : each other, the scoring and the prizes.
 @>Jump to Label: Choices
 @>
: When [Prizes]
 @>Text: When you win a game, you will recive 1 random 
  :    : card from your opponent from their Deck.
 @>Text: This also works the other way around: if you lose, 
  :    : you have to give your opponent one of your cards, 
  :    : chosen at random.
 @>Text: You can change what you win or lose from a game 
  :    : by using an optional game rule.
 @>Jump to Label: Choices
 @>
: When [Exit]
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 002
Event Name: Triple Triad card shop
(X,Y): (007,003)

Page #1
Conditions

Graphic: NPC 19

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Label: Shop Start
@>Text: Welcome to the Triad Card Shop.
@>Label: Choices
@>Show Choices: Buy Cards, Sell Cards, Information, Exit
(When Cancel: Choice 3)
: When [Buy Cards]
 @>Script: pbBuyTriads
 @>Text: Anything else I can do for you?
 @>Jump to Label: Choices
 @>
: When [Sell Cards]
 @>Script: pbSellTriads
 @>Text: Anything else I can do for you?
 @>Jump to Label: Choices
 @>
: When [Information]
 @>Text: Here is where you can purchase new cards for 
  :    : Triple Triad duels.
 @>Text: The selection grows as you catch and find new 
  :    : Pokémon and Puppets, so check often.
 @>Text: And, of course, stronger cards cost more 
  :    : than weaker cards.
 @>Jump to Label: Shop Start
 @>
: When [Exit]
 @>Text: Please come again.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 003
Event Name: Triple Triad duel
(X,Y): (005,009)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_YOUNGSTER

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \bI'm ready to duel with you.
@>Comment: The two numbers are the min and max level of the 
 :       : opponent respectively. Each number can be between 
 :       : 0 and 9 inclusive, and the max level must be higher 
 :       : than or equal to the min level.
@>Script: pbTriadDuel("Jack", 0, 5)
@>

:       :   ["countunplayed",
:       :   "samewins",

:       : )

:       :    :SQUIRTLE, :PIKACHU, :CLEFAIRY]
:       : )

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled

Trigger: Player Touch

List of Event Commands:
@>Play SE: 'Exit Door', 80, 100
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 8 frame(s)
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0010: Elevator current floor] == 4
 @>Transfer Player:[297: Celadon Condominiums], (051,028), No Fade
 @>
: Else
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0010: Elevator current floor] == 3
  @>Transfer Player:[297: Celadon Condominiums], (011,032), No Fade
  @>
 : Else
  @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0010: Elevator current floor] == 2
   @>Transfer Player:[297: Celadon Condominiums], (051,003), No Fade
   @>
  : Else
   @>Transfer Player:[297: Celadon Condominiums], (011,003), No Fade
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6

@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 8 frame(s)
@>Conditional Branch: Variable [0010: Elevator current floor] == 2
 @>Transfer Player:[296: Celadon Game Corner], (002,001), No Fade
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-85,-85,-50,0), @6
 @>
: Else
 @>Transfer Player:[308: Underground Lab], (004,025), No Fade
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 001
Event Name: Gym Terminal
(X,Y): (041,081)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Celadon City Gym, Erika, has a preference for
   :    : Grass-type Pokémon and Nature-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Grass-type
   :    : Pokémon, Nature-type Puppets are weak to Aero, Cryo,
   :    : Pyro, and Miasma-Typed moves.
  @>Text: Nature-Type Puppets resist damage from Beast, Hydro, Wind, Nature
   :    : Earth, Water, Electric, Grass, and Ground-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: In order to reach Erika, challengers must first navigate the gym
   :    : and its "Untampered Nature" in order to battle trainers which
   :    : unlock the door to her chambers.
  @>Text: The trainers in the gym will offer to heal the challenger as
   :    : opposed to battling them, but if they do then they will not
   :    : battle the challenger afterward.
  @>Text: Enough trainers must be beaten to unlock the door to Erika's
   :    : chambers. If the challenger doesn't battle enough, they must
   :    : restart the challenge entirely.
  @>Text: On the way to each trainer is a hallway full of Pokémon and
   :    : Puppets owned by the Gym, which will battle the challenger.
   :    : As they are owned by the gym, they cannot be caught.
  @>Text: Those hallways are filled with an aroma that calms the nerves
   :    : of those that breathe it in. As a result, experience growth in those
   :    : hallways is stunted entirely.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Despite the nobility of Kanto fading into obscurity many 
   :    : years ago, many people still treat Erika like a Princess,
   :    : even though the title exists in name only and has no
   :    : power.
  @>Text: She makes no effort to stop or encourage it though, focusing only
   :    : on her own interests- namely, her flower arranging.
  @>Text: As such, she imports flowers from various far away regions
   :    : to decorate the Gym with when it strikes her fancy.
  @>Text: In her free time, when she's not maintaining the gym, she
   :    : enjoys wandering into nearby meadows to doze off among
   :    : the flowers.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0007: Defeated Gym 4 is ON

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.\ch[1,-1,Gym Leader Preference,
  :    : Gym Mechanics,Gym Leader Information,Gym Rebattle Protocol]
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == -1
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Preference
  @>Text: The Celadon City Gym, Erika, has a preference for
   :    : Grass-type Pokémon and Nature-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Grass-type
   :    : Pokémon, Nature-type Puppets are weak to Aero, Cryo,
   :    : Pyro, and Miasma-Typed moves.
  @>Text: Nature-Type Puppets resist damage from Beast, Hydro, Wind, Nature
   :    : Earth, Water, Electric, Grass, and Ground-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1
  @>Comment: Gym Mechanics
  @>Text: In order to reach Erika, challengers must first navigate the gym
   :    : and its "Untampered Nature" in order to battle trainers which
   :    : unlock the door to her chambers.
  @>Text: The trainers in the gym will offer to heal the challenger as
   :    : opposed to battling them, but if they do then they will not
   :    : battle the challenger afterward.
  @>Text: Enough trainers must be beaten to unlock the door to Erika's
   :    : chambers. If the challenger doesn't battle enough, they must
   :    : restart the challenge entirely.
  @>Text: On the way to each trainer is a hallway full of Pokémon and
   :    : Puppets owned by the Gym, which will battle the challenger.
   :    : As they are owned by the gym, they cannot be caught.
  @>Text: Those hallways are filled with an aroma that calms the nerves
   :    : of those that breathe it in. As a result, experience growth in those
   :    : hallways is stunted entirely.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 2
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Information
  @>Text: Despite the nobility of Kanto fading into obscurity many 
   :    : years ago, many people still treat Erika like a Princess,
   :    : even though the title exists in name only and has no
   :    : power.
  @>Text: She makes no effort to stop or encourage it though, focusing only
   :    : on her own interests- namely, her flower arranging.
  @>Text: As such, she imports flowers from various far away regions
   :    : to decorate the Gym with when it strikes her fancy.
  @>Text: In her free time, when she's not maintaining the gym, she
   :    : enjoys wandering into nearby meadows to doze off among
   :    : the flowers.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 3
  @>Comment: Gym Rematch Protocol
  @>Script: $game_variables[129] = "Celadon Gym"
  @>Text: This will inform the Gym Leader and all trainers in 
   :    : the gym that you wish to challenge them again.
  @>Call Common Event: Gym Rematch Protocol
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

@>Call Common Event: Vs. Gold - Encounter
@>Text: \xn[Gold]Alright, let's do this, \pn!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 4
@>Control Variables: [0115: Vs. Transition - Background] = 4
@>Script: setBattleRule("base", "indoor1")
@>Comment: EndSpeech: _I(pbGet(4))
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:RIVAL_Gold, "Gold", 1+pbGet(116))
 @>Call Common Event: Vs. Gold - Post-Battle
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Set Move Route: [Gold]
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
  :              : $>SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0116: Battled Rival Gold] += 1
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Else
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>

 :    : if that might be intimidating.

 :    : do you perhaps need healing instead?

  :    : entirety of the city!

 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: When [I'll be back]
 @>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 008
Event Name: GT_Trainer
(X,Y): (039,009)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_COOLTRAINER_F

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Look sharp, a battle should always be conducted at your best!
@>Text: Unless you want healing, that works too! Just say the word!
@>Show Choices: Battle, Healing, I'll be back
(When Cancel: Choice 3)
: When [Battle]
 @>Script: pbTrainerIntro(:COOLTRAINER_F)
 @>Text: Let's get going then!
 @>Comment: EndSpeech: Marvelous work.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:COOLTRAINER_F, "Susan", 1+$player.badge_count)
  @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
  @>Control Variables: [0131: Celadon Gym Trainers] += 1
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Script: pbTrainerEnd
 @>
: When [Healing]
 @>Text: Healing, right, I can do that!
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Play SE: 'Voltorb Flip gain coins', 100, 100
 @>Text: See, all healed up! Good luck on the rest of your challenge!
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: When [I'll be back]
 @>
: Branch End
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 009
Event Name: GT_Erika
(X,Y): (039,037)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_LEADER_Erika

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Show Animation: [GT_Erika], [Exclaim bubble]
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Erika]Oh, pardon me, I must have dozed off again...
@>Text: \xn[Erika]My name is Erika, I'm the leader of the Celadon City Gym.
@>Text: \xn[Erika]As you can see around you, I love to immerse myself 
 :    : in nature, so I took up the art of flower arrangement and 
 :    : gardening.
@>Text: \xn[Erika]But, as much as I love gardening, I love battling as well.
 :    : So I shall accept your challenge as Gym Leader!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
@>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 3
@>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 3
@>Comment: EndSpeech: Oh! I concede defeat. You are remarkably strong.
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:LEADER_Erika, "Erika", 1+$player.badge_count)
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]You have quite an elegant and refined battling style, I
  :    : enjoyed having a match against you.
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]To show your victory over the Celadon Gym, I award
  :    : you with the Rainbow Badge. You've earned it!
 @>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Rainbow Badge!\wtnp[90]
 @>Script: $player.badges[3]=true # Rainbow Badge
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]Having the Rainbow Badge will allow your Pokémon or Puppets to use the move Strength outside of battle.
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]Strength is a skill that Pokémon and Puppets can learn that can be used to
  :    : push around heavy objects, like boulders or large flower pots.
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]Speaking of which, I would like to give you these as well.
 @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:TM86) # Grass Knot, Pokemon
 :       : pbReceiveItem(:SC19) # Giga Drain, Puppet
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
  @>Text: \xn[Erika]These items are Technical Machines and Skill Cards. They allow you to teach moves to your Pokémon and Puppets.
  @>Text: \xn[Erika]Certain skills can also be used in the field. These variants are usually called Hidden Machines and Hidden Skill Cards.
  @>Text: \xn[Erika]TMs, SCs, HMs, and HCs all have unlimited uses, so you don't need to worry about wasting
   :    : your only one.
  @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]The TM I gave you is Grass Knot. It is a move that will do more damage to targets that weigh more.
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]As for the SC, that's Giga Drain. It's a move that will drain the target of its health and return half of it to the user.
 @>Text: \xn[Erika]Very good moves with very specific niches... It is up to you to figure
  :    : out how you want to use them!
 @>Control Switches: [0007: Defeated Gym 4] = ON
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(2,"A",true)
 @>
: Branch End
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = OFF
@>

Event ID: 012
Event Name: EV012
(X,Y): (039,079)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC_PikeMaid

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to Celadon Gym. I am one of Lady Erika's maids.
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch A == OFF
 @>Text: Here at Celadon Gym, Erika is locked within her personal quarters,
  :    : and will not accept any challenges until the doors to her are 
  :    : unlocked.
 @>Text: In order to unlock the doors, you must first beat at least four of
  :    : the six trainers present in the gym.
 @>Text: However, each trainer will present you with a choice. They will
  :    : either heal your party, or battle you.
 @>Text: If you choose to have your party be healed, they will not battle
  :    : you during this attempt of the gym.
 @>Text: Why would you need healing, you may ask? Celadon Gym also
  :    : doubles as a greenhouse for plants, as well as Pokémon and
  :    : Puppets with an affinity for plants.
 @>Text: These Pokémon and Puppets are owned by the gym, and as such
  :    : they cannot be caught. 
 @>Text: If you leave the gym, your progress will be reset, and you will 
  :    : have to attempt the entire challenge from scratch.
 @>Text: If you find all of this to be agreeable...
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: Would you like to enter Celadon Gym today?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Allow me to escort you inside the gym.
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Control Switches: [0102: Special Battle Switch] = ON
 @>Control Variables: [0102: Special Battle Variable] = 3
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(3,"A",false)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch(4,"A",false)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch(5,"A",false)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch(6,"A",false)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch(7,"A",false)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch(8,"A",false)
 :       : pbSetSelfSwitch(34,"A",false)
 @>Control Variables: [0131: Celadon Gym Trainers] = 0
 @>Transfer Player:[301: Celadon Gym (Rooms)], (039,069), Up, No Fade
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: We understand. If you change your mind, please feel free to
  :    : come back.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Speed: 3: Slow

 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[302: Celadon Gym (Hallways)], (031,003), Down, No Fade

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 011
Event Name: Move Deleter
(X,Y): (022,004)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: NPC 13

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Uh...\nOh, yes, I'm the Move Deleter.
@>Text: I can make Pokemon forget their moves.
@>Text: Would you like me to do that?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Label: ChoosePokemon
 @>Text: Which Pokemon should forget a move?
 @>Script: pbChoosePokemon(1,3)
 @>Comment: If variable 1 is less than 0, it means the player has 
  :       : canceled choosing a Pokémon.
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
  @>Text: Come again if there are moves that need to be 
   :    : forgotten.
  @>
 : Else
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).egg?
   @>Text: What?  No Egg should know any moves.
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: (pbGetPokemon(1).isShadow? rescue false)
   @>Text: What?  I can't make Shadow Pokemon forget a 
    :    : move.
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbNumMoves(pbGetPokemon(1))==1
   @>Text: \v[3] seems to know only one move...
   @>Exit Event Processing
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Text: Which move should be forgotten?
  @>Script: pbChooseMove(pbGetPokemon(1),2,4)
  @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0002: Temp Move Choice] < 0
   @>Jump to Label: ChoosePokemon
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: Hm!  \v[3]'s \v[4]?  That move should be forgotten?
   @>Show Choices: Yes, No
   (When Cancel: Choice 2)
   : When [Yes]
    @>Play ME: '013-Gag02', 100, 100
    @>Wait: 80 frame(s)
    @>Script: pbDeleteMove(pbGetPokemon(1),
    :       : pbGet(2))
    @>Text: It worked to perfection!
    @>Text: \v[3] has forgotten \v[4] completely.
    @>
   : When [No]
    @>Text: Come again if there are moves that need to be 
     :    : forgotten.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: Come again if there are moves that need to be 
  :    : forgotten.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :    : thing, but now mysterious people are going into it? Without 
 :    : consulting me, the Warden's own granddaughter and current owner

@>Text: I ought to do something about this!

  :    : in there?

  :    : nerve of them!

  :    : this!
 @>Text: It was because of those ruins that Grandfather didn't feel
  :    : comfortable reopening the Safari Zone here in Kanto!
 @>Text: Let me guess, you wish to know more about those ruins as well, 
  :    : right? I can't imagine why else you would have been going into
  :    : the abandoned Safari Zone otherwise.
 @>Show Choices: Well..., No, not at all!
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Well...]
  @>Text: Well of course you did, everyone is curious about those 
   :    : ruins!
  @>
 : When [No, not at all!]
  @>Text: Oh come now, there's no need to lie! Everyone is curious
   :    : about those ruins.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: And honestly, so am I!
 @>Text: When I was younger, grandfather never let me get close to
  :    : them, saying it was dangerous.
 @>Text: So, I'll tell you what. How about we explore them together?
 @>Text: I'd love to put the mystery behind these ruins to rest once
  :    : and for all!
 @>Text: I'll meet you there!
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>Control Variables: [0133: Fuchsia Sidequest] = 1
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>Script: activateQuest(:Quest110)

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 015
Event Name: Gym Terminal
(X,Y): (036,048)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Fuchsia City Gym Leader, Janine, has a preference for
   :    : Poison Pokémon and Miasma Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Poison-type
   :    : Pokémon, Miasma-type Puppets are weak to Earth, Reason,
   :    : Ground, and Psychic-typed moves.
  @>Text: Miasma-Type Puppets resist damage from Miasma, Nature, Faith,
   :    : Heart, Grass, Fighting, Ground, and Bug-Typed moves.
  @>Text: In addition, Steel and Metal types are completely immune to damage
   :    : from Poison and Miasma-typed moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: In recent years. Janine has expanded upon the gym to 
   :    : make, what she claims to be, the "Ultimate Ninja Hideout".
  @>Text: Trap Doors, Invisible Walls, and her own personal body
   :    : doubles are set up to confound intruders and would-be
   :    : challengers.
  @>Text: Challengers must take caution to not get thrown off by the
   :    : carefully placed misdirection.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: Janine is the daughter of renowned ninja and former Johto
   :    : Elite 4 member, Koga, who also formerly held the position of
   :    : Fuchsia Gym Leader.
  @>Text: Despite her father disappearing from the public light several
   :    : years ago, she continues to uphold the traditions she was
   :    : raised around.
  @>Text: Not much is known about her life outside of being a Gym
   :    : Leader, though not for lack of trying. Being a ninja, Janine
   :    : manages to stay out of the limelight whenever she isn't
   :    : at the gym.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0008: Defeated Gym 5 is ON

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.\ch[1,-1,Gym Leader Preference,
  :    : Gym Mechanics,Gym Leader Information,Gym Rebattle Protocol]
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == -1
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Preference
  @>Text: The Fuchsia City Gym Leader, Janine, has a preference for
   :    : Poison Pokémon and Miasma Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Poison-type
   :    : Pokémon, Miasma-type Puppets are weak to Earth, Reason,
   :    : Ground, and Psychic-typed moves.
  @>Text: Miasma-Type Puppets resist damage from Miasma, Nature, Faith,
   :    : Heart, Grass, Fighting, Ground, and Bug-Typed moves.
  @>Text: In addition, Steel and Metal types are completely immune to damage
   :    : from Poison and Miasma-typed moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1
  @>Comment: Gym Mechanics
  @>Text: In recent years. Janine has expanded upon the gym to 
   :    : make, what she claims to be, the "Ultimate Ninja Hideout".
  @>Text: Trap Doors, Invisible Walls, and her own personal body
   :    : doubles are set up to confound intruders and would-be
   :    : challengers.
  @>Text: Challengers must take caution to not get thrown off by the
   :    : carefully placed misdirection.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 2
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Information
  @>Text: Janine is the daughter of renowned ninja and former Johto
   :    : Elite 4 member, Koga, who also formerly held the position of
   :    : Fuchsia Gym Leader.
  @>Text: Despite her father disappearing from the public light several
   :    : years ago, she continues to uphold the traditions she was
   :    : raised around.
  @>Text: Not much is known about her life outside of being a Gym
   :    : Leader, though not for lack of trying. Being a ninja, Janine
   :    : manages to stay out of the limelight whenever she isn't
   :    : at the gym.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 3
  @>Comment: Gym Rematch Protocol
  @>Script: $game_variables[129] = "Fuchsia Gym"
  @>Text: This will inform the Gym Leader and all trainers in 
   :    : the gym that you wish to challenge them again.
  @>Call Common Event: Gym Rematch Protocol
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(1)],(038,018), Up
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(2)],(008,016), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(2)],(016,017), Up
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(5)],(004,012), Right
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(2)],(018,007), Left
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(3)],(006,004), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer Janine's Bodydouble],(057,005), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer Janine's Bodydouble],(063,005), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Janine],(051,005), Down
  @>Set Event Location: [GT_Trainer(3)],(036,037), Left
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Freq: 6: Highest
Options Enabled

List of Event Commands:
@>Show Animation: [Gold Trainer(1)], [Exclaim bubble]
@>Conditional Branch: [Gold Trainer(1)] is facing Left
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>
: Else
 @>Conditional Branch: [Gold Trainer(1)] is facing Right
  @>Set Move Route: Player
   :              : $>Turn Left
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End

@>Text: \xn[Gold]Alright, let's do this, \pn!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 4
@>Control Variables: [0115: Vs. Transition - Background] = 4
@>Script: setBattleRule("base", "indoor1")
@>Comment: EndSpeech: Test
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:RIVAL_Gold, "Gold", 1+pbGet(116))
 @>Call Common Event: Vs. Gold - Post-Battle
 @>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Up
  @>Set Move Route: Player
   :              : $>Move Left
   :              : $>Turn Right
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Set Move Route: [Gold Trainer(1)]
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
  :              : $>SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0116: Battled Rival Gold] += 1
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(13,"A",true)
 @>
: Else
 @>Exit Event Processing
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :    : door and waltzing up to me. As if I didn't prepare for that!

 :    : press your luck? It's too late to turn back! Watch as the skills 
 :    : of the ninja confound you!

 :    : you?
@>Text: \xn[Janine]Well, sure! Why not! Someone who saw through 
 :    : my illusions and made it past my traps deserves to be given 
 :    : a reward.
@>Text: \xn[Janine]You're good at seeing through traps and disguises,
 :    : now let's see if you can unveil the tricks I use in battle!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
@>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
@>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 4
@>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 4
@>Comment: EndSpeech: So perceptive, you're able to see through a ninja's tricks!

  :    : Impressive indeed!
 @>Text: \xn[Janine]You took my tricks and revealed the secrets behind 
  :    : them expertly! I guess this means I need to train more if I 
  :    : want to become like my father.
 @>Text: \xn[Janine]To show your victory over Fuchsia Gym, I am
  :    : honored to present you with this badge!
 @>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Soul Badge!\wtnp[90]
 @>Script: $player.badges[4]=true # Soul Badge
 @>Text: \xn[Janine]With the Soul Badge, you now gain the ability 
  :    : to use the Field Move Surf outside of battle, which will allow 
  :    : you to cross bodies of water.
 @>Text: \xn[Janine]Before you leave, as is customary for Fuchsia Gym 
  :    : to hand to its victors, you shall take this Skill with you.
 @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:TM06) # Toxic, Pokemon
 :       : pbReceiveItem(:SC06) # Toxic, Puppet
 @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
  @>Text: \xn[Janine]Those two items are a Technical Machine and a Skill Card, which can impart knowledge of a skill onto a Pokémon or Puppet.
  @>Text: \xn[Janine]Other variants exist that allow you to use certain skills to navigate in the field, we call those Hidden Machines and Hidden Skill Cards.
  @>Text: \xn[Janine]All variants of teachable skills are unlimited, so you can use them whenever you want, however you want!
  @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Text: \xn[Janine]The skills I gave you contain the move Toxic. It's a 
  :    : vile technique, used to ensnare your foes with a steadily 
  :    : worsening poison status effect!
 @>Text: \xn[Janine]It's frightening how effective it is in battle!
 @>Control Switches: [0008: Defeated Gym 5] = ON
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(18,"A",true)
 @>
: Branch End
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = OFF
@>

 :       : $game_map.refresh

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 011
Event Name: Fossil reviver
(X,Y): (060,003)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_SCIENTIST

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: The fossil reviver finishes reviving the Pokémon as 
 :       : soon as you step out of the door. See the exit event 
 :       : on this map.
@>Conditional Branch: Self Switch B == OFF
 @>Text: Oh, hello. I work at Silph in the fossil restoration 
  :    : department.
 @>Text: I'm the one that can restore your fossils back to their 
  :    : original form!
 @>Control Self Switch: B =ON
 @>
: Else
 @>Text: Welcome back!
 @>
: Branch End
@>Text: Do you have a fossil for me to revive?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Which fossil should I revive?
 @>Script: pbChooseFossil(9)
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(9) != :NONE
  @>Comment: Player didn't choose a fossil.
  @>Text: Let me know when you want me to revive a 
   :    : fossil for you.
  @>
 : Else
  @>Comment: Player chose a fossil.
  @>Script: $bag.remove(pbGet(9))
  @>Script: data = GameData::Item.get(pbGet(9))
  :       : pbSet(3, data.name)
  @>Text: Okay. I'll see if I can revive your \v[3].
  @>Text: Come back later.
  @>Comment: Convert fossil into species now.
  @>Script: conversion_hash = {
  :       :   :HELIXFOSSIL => :OMANYTE,
  :       :   :DOMEFOSSIL  => :KABUTO,
  :       :   :OLDAMBER    => :AERODACTYL,
  :       :   :ROOTFOSSIL  => :LILEEP,
  :       :   :CLAWFOSSIL  => :ANORITH,
  :       :   :SKULLFOSSIL => :CRANIDOS,
  :       :   :ARMORFOSSIL => :SHIELDON,
  :       :   :MIKOFOSSIL => :CHAKUREI,
  :       :   :MAGIFOSSIL => :CKIRISAME
  :       : }
  @>Script: conversion_hash.merge!({
  :       :   :COVERFOSSIL => :TIRTOUGA,
  :       :   :PLUMEFOSSIL => :ARCHEN,
  :       :   :JAWFOSSIL   => :TYRUNT,
  :       :   :SAILFOSSIL  => :AMAURA
  :       : })
  @>Script: item = pbGet(9)
  :       : species = conversion_hash[item]
  :       : pbSet(9, species)
  @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
  @>Control Switches: [0013: Fossil revival in progress] = ON
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Comment: Player doesn't want to choose a fossil.
 @>Text: I'll be here if you want my help.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Self Switch A is ON

Graphic: trainer_SCIENTIST

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGet(9).is_a?(Symbol)
 @>Script: data = GameData::Species.get(
 :       :   pbGet(9)).name
 :       : pbSet(3, data.name)
 @>Text: Where have you been?  I've finished reviving 
  :    : your fossil.
 @>Text: It was \v[3] like I thought.
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbAddToParty(pbGet(9),1)
  @>Control Variables: [0009: Fossil being revived] = 0
  @>Control Self Switch: A =OFF
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: You have no room left.  Make room, then come see 
   :    : me.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Comment: This only happens when the fossil reviver is given an 
  :       : item that couldn't be turned into a species on page 1.
 @>Comment: This should never happen. If it does, there is a 
  :       : mistake in the conversion_hash on page 1, namely 
  :       : that it doesn't contain a "fossil => species" pair for 
  :       : the item given to the fossil reviver.
 @>Text: \bI managed to revive your fossil.
 @>Text: \bHowever, what I brought back didn't live long...\1 
  :    : fortunately.
 @>Text: \bSorry.
 @>Control Self Switch: A =OFF
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: I told you, come back later.
@>

  :    : can make some better progress. Or at least get some damn 
  :    : sleep.
 @>Text: \xn[Head Scientist]My sincerest apologies for the aggression, miss.
  :    : We're all just a group of scientists who were in a bit of a bind and
  :    : got contracted to do some work we aren't fully pleased with.

  :    : and if you know what's good for you, you won't repeat any of
  :    : what you've seen or heard here to anybody.

  :              : $>Turn Down
  :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)

 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No

: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0

 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)

 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON

  :              : $>Turn Down

  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.

   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.

   :    : exceptionally well.

 : Else

   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0

  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!

 : Branch End

 @>

@>

Page #2
Conditions

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion

:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end

 :              : $>Stop Animation ON

@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0

 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

Event Name: ExitArrow
(X,Y): (004,008)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: Exitarrow_red

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Stop Animation
Always on Top
Trigger: Player Touch

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Down
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[041: Saffron City], (039,024), No Fade
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 001
Event Name: Sabrina
(X,Y): (032,027)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_LEADER_Sabrina_FrLg

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Welcome to Saffron Gym... My name is Sabrina, I am 
 :    : the Gym Leader here.
@>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Do you wish to chalenge me...? I must warn you,
 :    : before you can battle me, you will lose all that you hold near
 :    : and dear, and must reclaim it.
@>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]This gym will test you in ways you haven't been
 :    : tested before... Many find it to be... uncomfortable.
@>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Are you sure you wish to undertake my challenge?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Then please, proceed, and good luck challenger.
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]I shall see you inside\..\..\..\wtnp[20]
 @>Fade Out BGM: 2 sec.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 80, 50
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @20
 @>Wait: 25 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Stare', 80, 50
 @>Wait: 25 frame(s)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>Transfer Player:[325: Saffron City Gym], (032,034), Down
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-170,0,85,0), @20
 @>Script: $game_variables[3] = nil
 :       : $game_variables[4] = []
 :       : 
 :       : $game_variables[3] = $player.party[0]
 :       :     for i in 1...$player.party.length
 :       :       pbGet(4).push($player.party[i])
 :       :     end
 :       : $player.party = [pbGet(3)]
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]I am certain I will see you again. For now, do take 
  :    : care.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 002
Event Name: Gym Terminal
(X,Y): (035,028)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.
 @>Show Choices: Gym Leader Preference, Gym Mechanics, Gym Leader Information, Nothing
 (When Cancel: Choice 4)
 : When [Gym Leader Preference]
  @>Text: The Saffron City Gym Leader, Sabrina, has a preference for
   :    : Psychic-type Pokémon and Reason-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Psychic-type
   :    : Pokémon, Reason-type Puppets are weak to Nether, 
   :    : Umbral, Heart, Bug, Ghost, and Dark-typed moves.
  @>Text: Reason-Type Puppets resist damage from Dream, Miasma, 
   :    : Faith, and Poison-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Mechanics]
  @>Text: \rWARNING - ERROR DETECTED IN "Gym Mechanics" 
   :    : PROTOCOL.
  @>Text: \rMISSING FILE "dollhouse.html".
  @>Text: \rPLEASE REPORT ISSUES TO LEAGUE ASSOCIATION.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Gym Leader Information]
  @>Text: From a young age, Sabrina exhibited extremely heightened
   :    : telekinetic abilities. This had the result of her becoming a
   :    : childhood superstar.
  @>Text: As she grew older, she became a more experienced psychic,
   :    : attaining mastery over telepathy, precognition, teleportation,
   :    : transmutation, just to name a few.
  @>Text: Recently, Sabrina has taken an interest in acting, and has 
   :    : taken frequent trips to the Unova Region to star in movies 
   :    : over there.
  @>Text: Between being a Gym Leader and an Actor, Sabrina has
   :    : been spotted going between Kanto and Unova at an 
   :    : alarming rate.
  @>Text: Furthermore, there has been reports that people have seen
   :    : Sabrina in Kanto while she's been overseas in Unova, and 
   :    : vice-versa. When asked about it, she remained silent.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : When [Nothing]
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Switch 0009: Defeated Gym 6 is ON

Graphic: gymtelecom

Autonomous Movement

Options Enabled

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Text: Accessing Gym Network.
 @>Label: Start
 @>Text: Please select what you want to know about.\ch[1,-1,Gym Leader Preference,
  :    : Gym Mechanics,Gym Leader Information,Gym Rebattle Protocol]
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == -1
  @>Text: Shutting down information database.
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 0
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Preference
  @>Text: The Saffron City Gym Leader, Sabrina, has a preference for
   :    : Psychic-type Pokémon and Reason-type Puppets.
  @>Text: Aside from the traditional weaknesses of Psychic-type
   :    : Pokémon, Reason-type Puppets are weak to Nether, 
   :    : Umbral, Heart, Bug, Ghost, and Dark-typed moves.
  @>Text: Reason-Type Puppets resist damage from Dream, Miasma, 
   :    : Faith, and Poison-type moves.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 1
  @>Comment: Gym Mechanics
  @>Text: \rIn my Gym you will be tasked with recovering your 
   :    : partners, scattered across a scale model of Saffron City.
  @>Text: \rGood luck, challenger.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 2
  @>Comment: Gym Leader Information
  @>Text: From a young age, Sabrina exhibited extremely heightened
   :    : telekinetic abilities. This had the result of her becoming a
   :    : childhood superstar.
  @>Text: As she grew older, she became a more experienced psychic,
   :    : attaining mastery over telepathy, precognition, teleportation,
   :    : transmutation, just to name a few.
  @>Text: Recently, Sabrina has taken an interest in acting, and has 
   :    : taken frequent trips to the Unova Region to star in movies 
   :    : over there.
  @>Text: Between being a Gym Leader and an Actor, Sabrina has
   :    : been spotted going between Kanto and Unova at an 
   :    : alarming rate.
  @>Text: Furthermore, there has been reports that people have seen
   :    : Sabrina in Kanto while she's been overseas in Unova, and 
   :    : vice-versa. When asked about it, she remained silent.
  @>Jump to Label: Start
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] == 3
  @>Comment: Gym Rematch Protocol
  @>Script: $game_variables[129] = "Saffrom Gym"
  @>Text: This will inform the Gym Leader and all trainers in 
   :    : the gym that you wish to challenge them again.
  @>Call Common Event: Gym Rematch Protocol
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]So, you have arrived... I welcome you to my chambers.
@>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]As I mentioned earlier, I am Sabrina, the leader of the
 :    : Saffron City Gym.
@>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Did you enjoy your stay in my personal sanctum? Did
 :    : you develop the skills you needed to take me on? Let's see how
 :    : well you can deal with my psychic powers!
@>Comment: #-------------------------
@>Conditional Branch: Script: rand(20) > 15
 @>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
 @>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
 @>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
 @>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 5
 @>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 5
 @>Play BGM: 'B-017. Battle! Kanto Gym Leader', 100, 100
 @>Call Common Event: Vs. Gym Leader (Fakeout)
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Question bubble]
 @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
 @>Play SE: 'Vs flash', 80, 100
 @>Control Switches: [0120: Sabrina Easter Egg] = ON
 @>Set Event Location: [GT_Sabrina (HgSs)],(033,005), Left
 @>Text: \xna[???]You aren't thinking of doing this without me, are you?
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Set Move Route: [GT_Sabrina]
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Oh, you've returned from your trip.
 @>Set Move Route: [GT_Sabrina (HgSs)]
  :              : $>Turn Up
 @>Text: \xna[???]Recording for this week wrapped up, so I decided to
  :    : return to the gym.
 @>Set Move Route: [GT_Sabrina (HgSs)]
  :              : $>Turn Left
 @>Text: \xna[???]But aside from that\..\..\..\wt[10] You.\wt[10] You're the one.
 @>Set Move Route: [GT_Sabrina]
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]...She's the one. Are you certain?
 @>Text: \xna[???]Yes... Upon returning to the gym, I could tell right away.
 @>Text: \xna[???]Her presence is the existence I foresaw two years
  :    : ago, at the height of the Puppet Invasion.
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Fascinating.
 @>Text: \xna[???]My apologies for dragging this on, I should introduce
  :    : myself.
 @>Text: \xna['Sabrina'?]My name is Sabrina. I am the gym leader of the
  :    : Saffron City Gym.
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Question bubble]
 @>Set Move Route: [GT_Sabrina]
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]You know, you're confusing her more by saying
  :    : that.
 @>Text: \xna['Sabrina'?]Oh, of course! Allow me to clarify then.
 @>Text: \xna['Sabrina'?]You see, I am the original Sabrina. The one 
  :    : you were introduced to is a construct I made to help me run 
  :    : the gym as I pursued my acting career.
 @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]Through the focusing of my psychic skills, I
  :    : have learned how to split my soul in two, to share my
  :    : conciousness with another entity.
 @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]Though she is completely separate from me,
  :    : in terms of both actions and personality, we can still sense 
  :    : each others thoughts and see what the other is seeing if we
  :    : focus on the other.
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Turn Up
 @>Set Move Route: [GT_Sabrina]
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Until now, nobody was aware of the existence 
  :    : of two separate Sabrinas. We have managed to keep this 
  :    : under wraps for years now.
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Though some people have spotted us at the 
  :    : same time, nobody has managed to figure out the truth.
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]But now that you know the truth... You can never
  :    : leave here! You shall become a pawn in my master plan! Mwa
  :    : ha ha ha!
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]...Perhaps you shouldn't have left the set so 
  :    : soon, "Bellelba".
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]What she means to say is, if you would like to
  :    : earn the Marsh Badge that we preside over, you will have
  :    : to battle us both.
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Turn Up
 @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]If you can best us both, you will have proved
  :    : your worth of our badge. Let us show you our powers!
 @>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
 @>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 30
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: !pbCanDoubleBattle?
  @>Script: setBattleRule("1v2")
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:LEADER_Sabrina_FrLg, "Sabrina", 1+$player.badge_count, :LEADER_Sabrina_HgSs, "Sabrina", 1+$player.badge_count)
  @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]The power of two psychic combined was not 
   :    : enough, I see... Our training is far from over.
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Having surpassed this surprise trial, you are
   :    : indeed more than worthy of the Marsh Badge.
  @>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Marsh Badge!\wtnp[90]
  @>Script: $player.badges[5]=true # Marsh Badge
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]The Marsh Badge will allow you to use the
   :    : move Rock Smash outside of battle.
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Rock Smash can be used to break certain
   :    : fragile objects in the field, not just boulders.
  @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]Of course, a skilled enough Psychic 
   :    : doesn't need Rock Smash to do that, but it does 
   :    : serve as a good starting point.
  @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]One last thing! Please, take these as well.
  @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:TM04) # Calm Mind, Pokemon
  :       : pbReceiveItem(:SC04) # Calm Mind, Puppet
  @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
   @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]Technical Machines and Skill Cards are items
    :    : you can use on a Pokémon ot Puppet to teach them new moves.
   @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]TMs and SCs can be used infinitely, so there is
    :    : no need to worry about who learns what move.
   @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Variants exist called Hidden Machines and 
    :    : Hidden Skill Cards. These are used in the field to clear
    :    : obstacles on your path, and will require a badge to be
    :    : used.
   @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Both of the machines we've given you
   :    : contain the move Calm Mind. They allow a Pokémon
   :    : or Puppet to focus its mind to raise their Special
   :    : Attack and Special Defense.
  @>Text: \xna[Sabrina]Psychic power exists inside everyone, sometimes
   :    : you just need a little push along the way to realize it. All it takes
   :    : is a bit of clarity.
  @>Control Switches: [0009: Defeated Gym 6] = ON
  @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch2(41,22,"A",true)
  @>Comment: --- Return Party ---
  @>Script:     for poke in pbGet(4)
  :       :       $player.party.push(poke) if poke != nil
  :       :     end
  @>Exit Event Processing
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Comment: #-------------------------
 @>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
 @>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 3
 @>Call Common Event: Vs. Transition - Badge to Ball Check
 @>Control Variables: [0113: Vs. Transition - Badge] = 5
 @>Control Variables: [0114: Vs. Transition - Leader] = 5
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:LEADER_Sabrina, "Sabrina", 1+$player.badge_count)
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]I see... You possess quite remarkable power.
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]You are worthy of the badge I oversee, the Marsh Badge.
  @>Text: \me[Badge get]You earned the Marsh Badge!\wtnp[90]
  @>Script: $player.badges[5]=true # Marsh Badge
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]The Marsh Badge will allow you to use the
   :    : move Rock Smash outside of battle.
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Before you go, please take these as well.
  @>Script: pbReceiveItem(:TM04) # Calm Mind, Pokemon
  :       : pbReceiveItem(:SC04) # Calm Mind, Puppet
  @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0108: TM/SC Explanation] == OFF
   @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Technical Machines and Skill Cards are items
    :    : you can use on a Pokémon ot Puppet to teach them new moves.
   @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]TMs and SCs can be used infinitely, so there is
    :    : no need to worry about who learns what move.
   @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Variants exist called Hidden Machines and 
    :    : Hidden Skill Cards. These are used in the field to clear
    :    : obstacles on your path, and will require a badge to be
    :    : used.
   @>Control Switches: [0108: TM/SC Explanation] = ON
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]Both of the machines I've given you
   :    : contain the move Calm Mind. They allow a Pokémon
   :    : or Puppet to focus its mind to raise their Special
   :    : Attack and Special Defense.
  @>Text: \xnb[Sabrina]The ability to focus one's mind to achieve 
   :    : clarity is a form of psychic power. Control over oneself,
   :    : and their mind, is the first step.
  @>Control Switches: [0009: Defeated Gym 6] = ON
  @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch2(41,22,"A",true)
  @>Comment: --- Return Party ---
  @>Script:     for poke in pbGet(4)

(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions
