Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 008
Event Name: Move Relearner
(X,Y): (022,009)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_LEADSCIENTIST

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Script: isTempSwitchOff?("A")
 @>Text: I'm the Pokémon Move Maniac.
 @>Text: I know every single move that Pokémon learn 
  :    : growing up.
 @>Text: I'm also a collector of Heart Scales.
 @>Text: If you bring me one, I'll teach a move to one of your 
  :    : Pokémon.
 @>Script: setTempSwitchOn("A")
 @>
: Branch End
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.has?(:HEARTSCALE)
 @>Text: Oh! That's it! That's an honest to goodness Heart 
  :    : Scale!
 @>Text: Let me guess, you want me to teach one of your 
  :    : Pokémon a move?
 @>Show Choices: Yes, No
 (When Cancel: Choice 2)
 : When [Yes]
  @>Label: ChoosePokemon
  @>Text: Which Pokémon needs tutoring?
  @>Script: pbChoosePokemon(1, 3, proc{ |pkmn|
  :       :   pkmn.can_relearn_move?
  :       :   }, true
  :       : )
  @>Comment: If Game Variable 1 is less than 0, it means the player 
   :       : has canceled choosing a Pokémon.
  @>Conditional Branch: Variable [0001: Temp Pokemon Choice] < 0
   @>Text: If your Pokémon need to learn a move, come back 
    :    : with a Heart Scale.
   @>
  : Else
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).egg?
    @>Text: Hunh? There isn't a single move that I can teach an 
     :    : Egg.
    @>Jump to Label: ChoosePokemon
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbGetPokemon(1).shadowPokemon?
    @>Text: No way, I don't want to go near a Shadow 
     :    : Pokémon..
    @>Jump to Label: ChoosePokemon
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: !pbGetPokemon(1).can_relearn_move?
    @>Text: Sorry...
    @>Text: It doesn't appear as if I have any move I can teach 
     :    : to your \v[3].
    @>Jump to Label: ChoosePokemon
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>Text: Which move should I teach to your \v[3]?
   @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbRelearnMoveScreen(pbGetPokemon(1))
    @>Script: $bag.remove(:HEARTSCALE)
    @>Text: \PN handed over one Heart Scale in exchange.
    @>Text: If your Pokémon need to learn a move, come back 
     :    : with a Heart Scale.
    @>
   : Else
    @>Text: If your Pokémon need to learn a move, come back 
     :    : with a Heart Scale.
    @>
   : Branch End
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>
 : When [No]
  @>Text: If your Pokémon need to learn a move, come back 
   :    : with a Heart Scale.
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: Else
 @>Text: If your Pokémon need to learn a move, come back 
  :    : with a Heart Scale.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 017
Event Name: EV017
(X,Y): (020,011)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: Scientist Alt (Aveontrainer)

Autonomous Movement
Type: Custom
Custom Move Route:
(Repeat Action)
$>Turn at Random

Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Yes, how can I help you?
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Show Animation: This event, [Exclaim bubble]
@>Text: What's that- You want access to the volcano!?
@>Text: Absolutely not! Right now we have reason to believe something 
 :    : is active within the volcano. Its not outside of the realm of possibility
 :    : that it could be on the verge of erupting again.
@>Text: As such, we cannot risk sending anybody inside right now!
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: ... Team Rocket has entered the Volcano, and they might have
 :    : something to do with the readings?
@>Text: Didn't they disband almost 10 years ago?
@>Text: Besides, even if it was Team Rocket, why would they suddenly 
 :    : want to erupt a volcano?
@>Text: I woudn't take them to be Ecoterrorists like those over in Hoenn.
@>Text: Still, you seem to have reason to believe that Team Rocket is inside
 :    : the Volcano...
@>Text: I'll tell you what. None of my team is brave enough to enter the
 :    : Volcano right now and investigate the source of these signals.
@>Text: I'll tell you what. None of my team is brave enough to enter the
 :    : Volcano right now and investigate the source of these signals.
@>Text: If you agree to find the source of it, I'll radio the guard and tell
 :    : them to let you through.
@>Text: Sound good?\n\wt[20]\..\..\..\wt[20]Splendid! I'll radio ahead!
@>Script: activateQuest(:Quest112)
@>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] = 14
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Page #2
Conditions

   :    : the last time I saw you.

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Conditions
Switch 0001: Starting over is ON

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Autorun

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Every map you can end up in after having all your 
 :       : Pokémon faint (typically Poké Centers and home) 
 :       : must have an Autorun event in it like this one.
 :       : This event fully heals all the player's Pokémon, says 
 :       : something to that effect, and turns the "Starting 
 :       : over" switch OFF again.
@>Comment: For convenience, this can be a single page in an 
 :       : NPC's event (e.g. Mom, a nurse).
@>Text: \rFirst, you should restore your Pokémon to full 
 :    : health.
@>Recover All: Entire Party
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Turn Left
 :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: for i in 1..$player.pokemon_count
:       :   pbSet(6, i)
:       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
:       :   pbWait(16)
:       : end
@>Set Move Route: [Healing balls]
 :              : $>Stop Animation ON
@>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
@>Wait: 58 frame(s)
@>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
@>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0

 :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
 :              : $>Turn Down
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rYour Pokémon have been healed to perfect health.
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
 :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: \rWe hope you excel!
@>Control Switches: [0001: Starting over] = OFF
@>

@>Text: Hey there, champ in the making! Yes, you! Are you prepared 
 :    : to scorch the ground with your presence? Well let me help you out!
@>Text: Cinnabar Island Gym was destroyed 7 years ago when the Volcano went off,
 :    : and was rebuilt a few years ago, completely redesigned. 
@>Text: Similar to its old design in terms of concept, the Gym Leader is
 :    : behind a blockade that can only be lowered by answering questions
 :    : or beating trainers.
@>Text: On opposite sides of the hallway reside three trainers and three
 :    : trivia machines. You must beat a total of three of either of these,
 :    : in any order, to be able to advance to the next hallway.
@>Text: Be warned though, if you fail at answering a question, you won't be 
 :    : able to try again, and you will need to fight a trainer to get through 
 :    : the blockade.
@>Text: If you want to preserve your Puppets for the Gym Leader,
 :    : I highly suggest knowing your random trivia!
@>Text: As for the types seen in the gym, Blaine, the leader, prefers to burn
 :    : things up with Fire types - both before and after the Puppet Invasion.
@>Text: Fire-based moves can leave a burn which will halve your Puppet's 
 :    : physical attack power, so having a way to deal with burns is an 
 :    : absolute must here!
@>Text: Fire Types have the most strengths in the type advantage chart. 
 :    : They can start wildfires which will eradicate Nature and the Beasts 
 :    : living inside.
@>Text: They can also melt down Ice and Steel into liquids 
 :    : with their hot temperatures!
@>Text: However, as expected, Fire Types have a crippling weakness
 :    : to Water Types - their infernos can't ignite under raging waters.
@>Text: And while Fire may burn Nature to a crisp, in the end, the Earth always
 :    : wins, as the remains from raging wildfires leave the Earth ready and
 :    : able to grow once again.
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 023
Event Name: EV023
(X,Y): (029,022)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Puppets evolve through leveling up, as well as through Evolution
 :    : Shards, such as the Power Shard and the Swift Shard.
@>Text: Your question is: What Shard is used to evolve Puppets into their 
 :    : Advent Form, if they have one?
@>Show Choices: Swift Shard, Solar Shard, Chrome Shard
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Swift Shard]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Solar Shard]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: When [Chrome Shard]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Solar Shard"!
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! The Solar Shard is used to
 :    : evolve Puppets to their Advent Form!
@>Control Variables: [0109: Unique Wild Battle] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(23,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(24,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Self Switch A is ON

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 025
Event Name: EV025
(X,Y): (032,016)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Kanto has several cities and towns, being a very large region
 :    : of the world.
@>Text: Your question is: How many gyms are there that are part of
 :    : the Kanto Region that are held in towns?
@>Show Choices: 3, 2, 1
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [3]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [2]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [1]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "1", and that solitary example is the
 :    : Lavender Town Gym!
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! Kanto has only one gym located
 :    : in a traditional town, and that would be Lavender Town Gym!
@>Control Variables: [0109: Unique Wild Battle] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(25,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(26,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 027
Event Name: EV027
(X,Y): (029,010)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Kanto and Johto are two parts of the same continent, only 
 :    : rejoined recently after the organization of the Pokemon 
 :    : League Challenge.
@>Text: Your question is: What is the name of the combined Kanto
 :    : and Johto Landmass?
@>Show Choices: Kajoh, Jotaro, Tohjo
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Kajoh]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Jotaro]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Tohjo]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Tohjo", as a combination of the
 :    : "To" in Kanto and "Jo" in Johto. The H was thrown in to make
 :    : the word easier to pronounce.
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! The Tohjo Continent was named
 :    : after its two largest regions, Kanto, "To", and Johto, "Jo".
@>Control Variables: [0109: Unique Wild Battle] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(27,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(28,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Event ID: 029
Event Name: EV029
(X,Y): (011,011)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Saffron City has two gyms, only one of them is officially
 :    : sanctioned by the Pokemon League Federation.
@>Text: Your question is: What is the name of the Saffron Dojo's
 :    : Dojo Master?
@>Show Choices: Buront, Brawny, Brony
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Buront]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: When [Brawny]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Brony]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Buront". He was made the Dojo 
 :    : Master around 4 years ago.
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! Buront is the name of the Saffron
 :    : Dojo Master.
@>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(29,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(30,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 031
Event Name: EV031
(X,Y): (009,016)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Certain moves can leave nasty status effects on your Puppets,
 :    : rendering them unable to do certain things!
@>Text: Your question is: Which of these moves will directly make it so 
 :    : your Puppet's physical attack is halved?
@>Show Choices: Scald, Burn Powder, Tri-Attack
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Scald]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Burn Powder]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: When [Tri-Attack]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Burn Powder". While all those moves
 :    : can inflict a Burn status effect, Burn Powder is the only of the
 :    : three that has a 100% chance of inflicting burn.
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! Burn Powder will always inflict
 :    : a Burn status effect on the foe, and as a result cause the
 :    : foe's Physical Attack to be halved.
@>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(31,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(32,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Page #2
Conditions
Self Switch A is ON

Event ID: 032
Event Name: EV032
(X,Y): (010,016)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Certain moves can leave nasty status effects on your Puppets,
 :    : rendering them unable to do certain things!
@>Text: Your question is: Which of these moves will directly make it so 
 :    : your Puppet's physical attack is halved?
@>Show Choices: Scald, Burn Powder, Tri-Attack
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Scald]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Burn Powder]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: When [Tri-Attack]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Burn Powder". While all those moves
 :    : can inflict a Burn status effect, Burn Powder is the only of the
 :    : three that has a 100% chance of inflicting burn.
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! Burn Powder will always inflict
 :    : a Burn status effect on the foe, and as a result cause the
 :    : foe's Physical Attack to be halved.
@>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(31,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(32,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!

 :    : stats. Each puppet is unique, but puppets of the same species 
 :    : share a Common Base Stat Total.
@>Text: Your question is: Defense Layla and Defense Patchouli. Which of
 :    : the two Puppets has the lowest Base Stat Value in Speed?

 @>

@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100

 :    : has a Speed value of 5, while Defense Layla has a
 :    : Speed value of 10.

@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing

 :    : lowest Speed stat, at 5, while Defense Layla comes in
 :    : behind at 10.

Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation

@>Text: Hey there, champ in the making! Yes, you! Are you prepared 
 :    : to scorch the ground with your presence? Well let me help you out!
@>Text: Cinnabar Island Gym was destroyed 7 years ago when the Volcano went off,
 :    : and was rebuilt a few years ago, completely redesigned. 
@>Text: Similar to its old design in terms of concept, the Gym Leader is
 :    : behind a blockade that can only be lowered by answering questions
 :    : or beating trainers.
@>Text: On opposite sides of the hallway reside three trainers and three
 :    : trivia machines. You must beat a total of three of either of these,
 :    : in any order, to be able to advance to the next hallway.
@>Text: Be warned though, if you fail at answering a question, you won't be 
 :    : able to try again, and you will need to fight a trainer to get through 
 :    : the blockade.
@>Text: If you want to preserve your Puppets for the Gym Leader,
 :    : I highly suggest knowing your random trivia!
@>Text: As for the types seen in the gym, Blaine, the leader, prefers to burn
 :    : things up with Fire types - both before and after the Puppet Invasion.
@>Text: Fire-based moves can leave a burn which will halve your Puppet's 
 :    : physical attack power, so having a way to deal with burns is an 
 :    : absolute must here!
@>Text: Fire Types have the most strengths in the type advantage chart. 
 :    : They can start wildfires which will eradicate Nature and the Beasts 
 :    : living inside.
@>Text: They can also melt down Ice and Steel into liquids 
 :    : with their hot temperatures!
@>Text: However, as expected, Fire Types have a crippling weakness
 :    : to Water Types - their infernos can't ignite under raging waters.
@>Text: And while Fire may burn Nature to a crisp, in the end, the Earth always
 :    : wins, as the remains from raging wildfires leave the Earth ready and
 :    : able to grow once again.
@>

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Puppets evolve through leveling up, as well as through Evolution
 :    : Shards, such as the Power Shard and the Swift Shard.
@>Text: Your question is: What Shard is used to evolve Puppets into their 
 :    : Advent Form, if they have one?
@>Show Choices: Swift Shard, Solar Shard, Chrome Shard
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Swift Shard]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Solar Shard]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: When [Chrome Shard]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Solar Shard"!
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! The Solar Shard is used to
 :    : evolve Puppets to their Advent Form!
@>Control Variables: [0109: Unique Wild Battle] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(23,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(24,"A",true)

 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Kanto has several cities and towns, being a very large region
 :    : of the world.
@>Text: Your question is: How many gyms are there that are part of
 :    : the Kanto Region that are held in towns?
@>Show Choices: 3, 2, 1
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [3]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [2]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [1]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!

 :    : Lavender Town Gym!

 :    : in a traditional town, and that would be Lavender Town Gym!

Event Name: EV027
(X,Y): (029,010)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Kanto and Johto are two parts of the same continent, only 
 :    : rejoined recently after the organization of the Pokemon 
 :    : League Challenge.
@>Text: Your question is: What is the name of the combined Kanto
 :    : and Johto Landmass?
@>Show Choices: Kajoh, Jotaro, Tohjo
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Kajoh]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Jotaro]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Tohjo]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Tohjo", as a combination of the
 :    : "To" in Kanto and "Jo" in Johto. The H was thrown in to make
 :    : the word easier to pronounce.
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! The Tohjo Continent was named
 :    : after its two largest regions, Kanto, "To", and Johto, "Jo".
@>Control Variables: [0109: Unique Wild Battle] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(27,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(28,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON

Event ID: 031
Event Name: EV031
(X,Y): (009,016)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Certain moves can leave nasty status effects on your Puppets,
 :    : rendering them unable to do certain things!
@>Text: Your question is: Which of these moves will directly make it so 
 :    : your Puppet's physical attack is halved?
@>Show Choices: Scald, Burn Powder, Tri-Attack
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Scald]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Burn Powder]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: When [Tri-Attack]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Burn Powder". While all those moves
 :    : can inflict a Burn status effect, Burn Powder is the only of the
 :    : three that has a 100% chance of inflicting burn.
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! Burn Powder will always inflict
 :    : a Burn status effect on the foe, and as a result cause the
 :    : foe's Physical Attack to be halved.
@>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(31,"A",true)
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(32,"A",true)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Event ID: 033
Event Name: EV033
(X,Y): (011,021)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: Welcome to the Cinnabar Gym Trivia Machine! Have you got what it
 :    : takes to avoid all the trainers? Let's test your knowledge!
@>Text: Puppets have different stats and different growths for their 
 :    : stats. Each puppet is unique, but puppets of the same species 
 :    : share a Common Base Stat Total.
@>Text: Your question is: Defense Layla and Defense Patchouli. Which of
 :    : the two Puppets has the lowest Base Stat Value in Speed?
@>Show Choices: Defense Patchouli, Defense Layla, Both are tied
(When Cancel: Disallow)
: When [Defense Patchouli]
 @>Jump to Label: RIGHT
 @>
: When [Defense Layla]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: When [Both are tied]
 @>Jump to Label: WRONG
 @>
: Branch End
@>Label: WRONG
@>Play SE: 'buzzer', 100, 100
@>Text: That is incorrect! Sorry for your loss!
@>Text: The correct answer was "Defense Patchouli", who
 :    : has a Speed value of 5, while Defense Layla has a
 :    : Speed value of 10.
@>Text: Well, that's all from this machine! Enjoy your stay in Cinnabar Gym!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Exit Event Processing
@>Label: RIGHT
@>Play SE: 'itemlevel', 100, 100
@>Text: That is the correct answer! Defense Patchouli has the
 :    : lowest Speed stat, at 5, while Defense Layla comes in
 :    : behind at 10.
@>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] += 1
@>Text: Congratulations, you've got one more counter on the gate being 
 :    : opened!
@>Text: Good luck on the rest of your challenge, contestant!
@>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(33,"A",true)

@>Control Self Switch: A =ON

Event ID: 001
Event Name: ExitArrow
(X,Y): (012,012)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: Exitarrow_red

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Stop Animation
Always on Top
Trigger: Player Touch

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Right
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[061: Route 16], (037,023), No Fade
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>
: Branch End
@>

(X,Y): (031,039)

Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Event Touch

@>Script: pbNoticePlayer(get_self)
@>Text: Ooh! A trainer native to Kanto! Lets see how you fare 
 :    : against someone from Hoenn!
@>Comment: EndSpeech: Wait, you're not native to Kanto?
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(PBTrainers::CYCLIST_F, "Alyssa", 0)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>Script: pbTrainerEnd
@>

Event ID: 071
Event Name: Articuno
(X,Y): (077,181)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: OW - 144

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Stop Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Change Battle BGM: 'B-024. Battle! Vs. Legendary Pokemon', 100, 100
@>Control Switches: [0142] = ON
@>Play SE: '144Cry', 100, 100
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Memorize BGM/BGS
@>Play BGM: '065. Legends of the Past (Vs. Legendary Birds)', 100, 100
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @3
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Show Picture: 1, 'Vs. Articuno_Shadow', Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Move Picture: 1, @5, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
@>Show Picture: 1, 'Vs. Articuno 1', Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 25 frame(s)
@>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
@>Show Picture: 1, 'Vs. Articuno 2', Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 255, Normal
@>Wait: 25 frame(s)
@>Move Picture: 1, @10, Center (256,192), (100%,100%), 0, Normal
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Erase Picture: 1
@>Script: pbWildBattle(PBSpecies::ARTICUNO,65,1,false,false)
@>Restore BGM/BGS
@>Control Switches: [0142] = OFF
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @10
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Play SE: '144Cry', 100, 100
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Play SE: 'Whirlwind', 100, 100
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
@>Wait: 10 frame(s)
@>Text: The Articuno flew off to an unknown location!
@>Wait: 25 frame(s)
@>Play SE: '873Cry', 100, 80
@>Wait: 15 frame(s)
@>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Transfer Player:[165: Bamboo Forest of the Lost], (057,170), Up, No Fade
@>Control Switches: [0145] = ON

Event ID: 001
Event Name: Counter(4)
(X,Y): (057,038)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_TEAMROCKET_M

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Event Touch

List of Event Commands:
@>Show Animation: This event, [Exclaim bubble]
@>Set Move Route: This event
                  (Ignore If Can't Move)
 :              : $>Move toward Player
 :              : $>Move toward Player
 :              : $>Move toward Player
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Text: Hold on a minute, how did you get down here?
@>Text: ..Wait... Aren't you...
@>Wait: 5 frame(s)
@>Text: ... Nope, I'm not touching this one. You can go get 
 :    : trounced by the two ahead. I'm sure they'll be pleased!
@>Text: Have fun getting wasted, runt!
@>Control Self Switch: A =ON
@>

Conditions

@>Text: I just... don't have any puppets available right now. Anything left
 :    : would be defeated by you in a blink.
@>Text: I used them all up trying to make my way down here, okay!?
@>

@>Script: pbNoticePlayer(get_self)
@>Text: We heard about you from our commander, she seems to be expecting you. A shame you won't be getting to her!
@>Comment: EndSpeech: I guess that this is why she was expecting you!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:TEAMROCKET_F, "Grunt", 26)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>Script: pbTrainerEnd
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 004
Event Name: Celeste
(X,Y): (016,019)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Graphic: trainer_TEAMROCKET_Celeste

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Direction Fix
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]Correct, Boss. The lead at the 
 :    : Volcano is a dead end as well.
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]The scanner isn't picking up the 
 :    : expected energy fluctuations.
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]While it's possible that the extreme
 :    : heat is frying the internals, we have exhausted all avenues of
 :    : passage in the volcano.
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]Understood, Sir. I shall have us 
 :    : return to the western command base.
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]However, I have some clean-up
 :    : to take care of here.
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]Yes, it would appear that the
 :    : one who did Stratos and Astra in is here.
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]I won't be long.
@>Text: \xn[Team Rocket Executive]Celeste, over and out.
@>Play SE: 'PC close', 100, 100
@>Wait: 40 frame(s)
@>Set Move Route: This event
 :              : $>Direction Fix OFF
 :              : $>Turn toward Player
@>Wait for Move's Completion
@>Wait: 20 frame(s)
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]Let me guess- \pn, correct? Couldn't take Astra's 
 :    : advice and leave well enough alone, could you?
@>Text: \xn[\pn]Well after she mentioned you guys would be here next,
 :    : how could I resist crashing the party!
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]Meddlesome twerp indeed, you're just like your 
 :    : mentor afterall.
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]Well then, allow me to introduce myself.
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]I am Celeste, one of Team Rocket's Elite 
 :    : Commanders.
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]I serve as our boss, Giovanni's, direct right hand.
 :    : As such, there is nothing I wouldn't do to see his ambitions
 :    : realized.
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]I can see it in your eyes, a similar tenacity. You have
 :    : a goal that you're looking to fufill, no matter how long it takes or 
 :    : whatever stands in your way.
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]In a way, you and I are alike!
@>Text: \xn[\pn]Well <i>unlike</i> you and your organization, I don't 
 :    : need to resort to criminal activity to achieve my goals!
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]And there's that stubborn sense of righteousness
 :    : that Astra mentioned! Does it truly matter how one achieves
 :    : their goals, so long as they are achieved?
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]Pokémon, Puppets, people- all are to be used to
 :    : further Team Rocket's ambitions!
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]I put my life on the line for Team Rocket, and if you 
 :    : think your self-perceived notions of righteousness are able to 
 :    : contend against the ideals of Team Rocket, you'd best be ready 
 :    : to lay your life on the line as well.
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]I'm a cut above Stratos and Astra, and I will
 :    : succeed where they failed to put you in your place.
@>Text: \xn[Celeste]And it looks like you're all alone this time. A pity that
 :    : the advantage you had over Astra won't help you here!
@>Text: \xn[\pn]I won't need her help knocking you off your high horse!
@>Text: \xn[Astra]We'll see about that! Come at me, trainer!
@>Control Switches: [0104: Transition Handler] = ON
@>Control Variables: [0103: Vs. Transition ID] = 7
@>Control Variables: [0104: Vs. Transition - Pkmn] = 5
@>Control Switches: [0123: Hide AI Swap Text] = ON
@>Comment: EndSpeech: Astra: Is that it?
@>Conditional Branch: Script: TrainerBattle.start(:TEAMROCKET_Celeste, "Celeste")
 @>Control Switches: [0123: Hide AI Swap Text] = OFF
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]Despite my best plans to halt you, it would seem
  :    : you lucked out this time.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Luck had nothing to do with it, I out-battled you, 
  :    : despite your tricks!
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]You have quite the brazen mouth! But do you think 
  :    : your victory here will change anything though?
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]Team Rocket is still an active force, and we are 
  :    : rapidly honing in on our desired result. This doesn't even
  :    : register as a setback- my loss is a non-issue.
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]If you want my professional advice, Team Rocket 
  :    : hasn't completely blacklisted you yet. If you walk away now, 
  :    : we can overlook these transgressions against us.
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]I, however, must be taking my leave. Our Boss 
  :    : requires us elsewhere, and it's my job to round up the grunts.
 @>Play SE: 'PC open', 100, 100
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]Attention all members of Team Rocket within
  :    : Cinnabar Volcano. You are hereby ordered to fall back to
  :    : the Western Command Base, on the double!
 @>Play SE: 'PC close', 100, 100
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]You should follow the example of our subordinates
  :    : and listen to orders. You will be much better off in the long
  :    : run!
 @>Text: \xn[Celeste]Goodbye, \pn. May we not meet again.
 @>Control Variables: [0110: Plot Control Variable] = 15
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Set Move Route: [Celeste]
  :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
 @>Wait: 6 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 80, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>Wait: 30 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]"Western Command", huh? I wonder where that is...
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Well, either way... I didn't get any new info out of 
  :    : them. I still can't shake the suspicion that...-\
 @>Text: \wt[5]<icon=icon_phone>\se[Phone ring]\b\ts[]Ring...!\wt[10] Ring...!\wt[10] Ring...!\wt[10] Ring...!\wtnp[40]
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]\se[PC access]<icon=icon_phone>\bHello, 
  :    : \pn, are you there? It's me, Professor Oak!
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]<icon=icon_phone>\bWhere are you, I'm picking up a
  :    : ton of static feedback!
 @>Text: \xn[Professor Oak]<icon=icon_phone>\bI'll just make this quick
  :    : then! Swing by my lab when you get the chance, I have
  :    : something to tell you!
 @>Text: <icon=icon_phone>\se[Phone hangup]\ts[]Click!\wt[10]\n......\wt[10] ......\wtnp[40]
 @>Script: completeQuest(:Quest25)
 :       : activateQuest(:Quest26)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Branch End
@>

List of Event Commands:
@>Conditional Branch: Player is facing Down
 @>Play SE: 'Door exit', 100, 100
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 8 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[348: Cinnabar Volcano], (059,065), No Fade

 @>Comment: Gate 2 --------------- 
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(34,"A",true)
 @>Comment: Switches -------------------------
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(55,"A",true)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>

 @>
: Branch End
@>

(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Why not!
 @>Play SE: 'Battle catch click', 80, 100
 @>Wait: 5 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Mining collapse', 80, 100
 @>Comment: Gate 1 --------------- 
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(33,"A",false)
 @>Comment: Gate 2 --------------- 
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(34,"A",false)
 @>Comment: Switches -------------------------
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(55,"A",false)
 @>Control Self Switch: A =OFF
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: Might be a good idea to leave this alone!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 001
Event Name: EV001
(X,Y): (023,010)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Player descends down here, inspects the gate, sees 
 :       : that it takes a keycard.
@>Comment: "Keycard" becomes a hidden item at this point and is 
 :       : hidden in the room. Player needs itemfinder to find it.
@>Comment: Once the player finds the keycard, the cutscene 
 :       : takes them back to the gate to unlock it, when 
 :       : suddenly the eastern wall is blown open by Yumemi 
 :       : Okazaki, the player's former university professor.
@>Comment: After talking for a few moments, Yumemi then blasts 
 :       : down the gate leading into the main chamber.
@>Comment: Inside the main chamber, the player and Yumemi 
 :       : discover an abandoned medical facility - after Yumemi 
 :       : inspects it, she discovers that it's not just any medical 
 :       : facility, but an abandoned Cloning Faciliy.
@>Comment: After scouring the area, Yumemi declares the area 
 :       : unimportant to her, and tells the player she'll be in 
 :       : her ship, which is parked just outside the mansion.
@>Comment: Yumemi also tells the player that they can use the 
 :       : ship as a place to rest, as well as a quick port up to 
 :       : the surface. She then leaves for her ship, leaving the 
 :       : player in the cloning facility.
@>Comment: 
@>Comment: The Cloning facility will play a little importance later, 
 :       : as the player can bring Rikako Asakura (in postgame) 
 :       : to the machines and have her fix them.
@>Comment: When the machines are fixed, the player can then 
 :       : use it to recreate the Legendary Pokemon Mew, and 
 :       : later (if it can be figured out how) clone one of the 
 :       : player's Puppets/Pokemon. The machine will need a 
 :       : day of cooldown, to not abuse the function.
@>Comment: 
@>Comment: In one of the machines, if the player interacts with it, 
 :       : they will discover a creature that looks corrupted. 
 :       : When the player goes to get a closer look, the 
 :       : creature wakes up, unleashes a deafaning cry, and 
 :       : escapes into the world.
@>Comment: It is unrevealed what this creature is in Faith & 
 :       : Prayer Version, but this creature was the failed 
 :       : attempt at cloning Mew the first time around - that 
 :       : creature's name was MissingNo, the infamous Glitch 
 :       : Pokemon of R/B Fame.
@>Comment: The Original MissingNo escapes to Gurichi Island in 
 :       : the remote Yitria Region, where it remains 
 :       : undistrubed for a thousand years until the events of 
 :       : Yitria Resurrection.
@>Comment: 
@>Comment: In the Postgame, one of the portals to Gensokyo can 
 :       : be found here. The portal will lead to Chireiden's 
 :       : front gates.
@>

 :       : causing her ship to be unable to leave its current location.

Event ID: 009
Event Name: Yumemi (2)
(X,Y): (030,005)

Page #1
Conditions
Variable 0141: Pkmn Mansion Progress is 2 or above

Graphic: Person_Yumemi

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: \xn[Yumemi]There's nothing in here that even <i>remotely</i>
 :    : resembles a signal jammer!
@>Conditional Branch: Script: $bag.has?(:FAILEDCLONE)
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Actually, Yumemi, I found this just now. Here, take a 
  :    : look at this page here.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Hmm? What's this?
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Well I'll be a Primeape's uncle! It's all coming 
  :    : together now!
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]That means our "Signal Jammer"...
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]...Is actually the failed clone, Experiment M0, through no 
  :    : inherent fault of its own.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Be that as it may... It is still causing interference 
  :    : with electronics- most importantly, my ship!
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]What should we do, then? 
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Shutting down the machine and letting it escape 
  :    : would be the easiest solution.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Given that it's managed to avoid complete cellular
  :    : collapse in the twenty years it's been... "alive"... it's possible
  :    : that it may have the strength to survive on its own.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]That's some wishful thinking there!
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Give me a break here! This goes way over my 
  :    : head! Do <i>you</i> have any better ideas?
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]...No... I was thinking the same thing as well, 
  :    : honestly.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]I'll give you a moment to steel yourself for the
  :    : process. It's not outside the realm of possibility that it may
  :    : charge us once free.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Once you're ready, we'll pull the switches. Just
  :    : tell me when you're ready!
 @>Control Self Switch: A =ON
 @>
: Else
 @>Comment: -----
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]All that's in here is a containment pod with a specimen
  :    : still inside it.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]A... rather degraded specimen at that. It's probably
  :    : best you don't look at it.
 @>
: Branch End
@>

 :    : it could go berserk and lash out at either of us.
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]

  :              : $>SE: 'Automatic Door', 100, 100

  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Right
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Up
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Right
  :              : $>Move Up
 @>Set Move Route: [Yumemi (2)]
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Up
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]I think we've roused the beast.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Oh, I have such a bad feeling about this!
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Electronic Malfunction', 80, 100
 @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Show Animation: [Yumemi (2)], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Electronic Malfunction', 80, 100
 @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Electronic Malfunction', 80, 100
 @>Screen Flash: (255,255,255,255), @10
 @>Set Event Location: [MissingNo],(030,004)
 @>Set Move Route: [MissingNo]
  :              : $>Through ON
  :              : $>Change Opacity: 255
  :              : $>Move Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Is... Is that Experiment M0?
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]I do believe so... Looks like it can still move.
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Show Animation: [MissingNo], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'M0Cry', 100, 100
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Question bubble]
 @>Show Animation: [Yumemi (2)], [Question bubble]
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Ow- Jeez, that's so loud! I-Is that M0 making that 
  :    : noise!?
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]What!? I can't hear you over that impossibly 
  :    : guttural cry!
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]I don't think my eardrums are going to be okay after 
  :    : th-\se[M0Cry]\wt[5]Not again!
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]\pn, watch out! I think it's rearing up for an 
  :    : attack!
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'M0Cry', 100, 100
 @>Script: $bag.add($bag.pockets[1][5][0],127)
 :       : $bag.add($bag.pockets[2][5][0],127)
 @>Wait: 40 frame(s)
 @>Control Switches: [0103: Hide AI Lvl in battle] = ON
 @>Script: WildBattle.dx_start([:MEW, 100], { 
 :       :   :nocapture => true, 
 :       :   :canlose => true,
 :       :   :backdrop => ["Factory", "Factory"],
 :       :   :outcome => 1,
 :       :   :noflee => true,
 :       :   :bgm => "W-031. Fires of Hokkai",
 :       :   :victory => :None,
 :       :   :introtext => "Experiment M0 lashes out at you!" 
 :       : }, 
 @>Script: {
 :       :   :ability => :MOODY,
 :       :   :nature  => :LONELY,
 :       :   :shiny   => false,
 :       :   :moves   => [:SCALD, :SKYATTACK, :PSYSHOCK, :DISCHARGE],
 :       :   :form    => 1,
 :       :   :name    => "M-Zero",
 :       :   :ivs     => 31
 :       : }, :VS_MISSINGNO)
 @>Control Switches: [0103: Hide AI Lvl in battle] = OFF
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Look out, \pn! I think it's revving up for one final 
  :    : attack!
 @>Play SE: 'M0Cry', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 30 frame(s)
 @>Text: \bExperiment M0 became cloaked in an impossibly blinding 
  :    : light!
 @>Script: pbSEPlay("Anim/PRSFX- Sky Attack1")
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (255,255,255,0), @20
 @>Wait: 45 frame(s)
 @>Text: \bExperiment M0 used Sky Attack!
 @>Script: pbSEPlay("Anim/PRSFX- Sky Attack2")
 :       : pbSEPlay("Anim/PRSFX- Sky Attack3")
 @>Wait: 40 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Explosion2', 80, 50
 @>Screen Shake: 3, 5, @25
 @>Script: pbSetSelfSwitch(15,"A",true)
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-102,-102,-102,51), @20
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Fade Out BGM: 1 sec.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]... \wt[10]Did... Did it escape?
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Well... Judging by that new hole in the ceiling, I'd 
  :    : say so, yeah.
 @>Wait: 30 frame(s)
 @>Play SE: 'Phone ring', 80, 100
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Show Animation: [Yumemi (2)], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Set Move Route: Player
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Set Move Route: [Yumemi (2)]
  :              : $>Turn Left
 @>Wait: 50 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Is that your phone?
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]That it is! Which means that reception is back!
 @>Set Move Route: [Yumemi (2)]
  :              : $>Turn Right
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]\se[PC access]Yes, this is Yumemi speaking how may
  :    : I h-\wt[20] -Chiyuri please, we <i>just</i> got reception back!
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Yes, the situation has been dealt with, start running 
  :    : diagnostics on the ship! Make sure everything is in working 
  :    : order when I get back!
 @>Play SE: 'Phone hangup', 80, 100
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Well, that's a relief!
 @>Set Move Route: [Yumemi (2)]
  :              : $>Turn Left
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Looks like Experiment M0 was the culprit indeed!
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Hopefully wherever it escaped to, it can live in peace...
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]One can only hope! For now, though, I must be
  :    : heading back to my ship.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]I won't be leaving right away, so feel free to drop
  :    : by the ship! I'll have Chiyuri set up a teleporter back to the
  :    : surface for you!
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Oh, and be sure to bring \v[108] next time you visit,
  :    : too! I'd love to catch up with the both of you!
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]I'll keep that in mind, thanks Yumemi!
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Safe travels, \PN! I wish you and \v[108] all the
  :    : luck in trying to find the Sealed Realm!
 @>Set Move Route: [Yumemi (2)]
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>SE: 'Door exit', 80, 100
  :              : $>Change Opacity: 0
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Wait: 5 frame(s)
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]I should head back up to the Seismology Center so
  :    : I can report my findings back there.
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]...Though, I think I'll leave out the part about M0. No
  :    : need to cause a panic about rouge clone armies.
 @>Script: advanceQuestToStage(:Quest113, 2)
 @>Control Variables: [0141: Pkmn Mansion Progress] = 3
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \xn[\pn]Give me a moment more to prepare.
 @>Text: \xn[Yumemi]Understood, but don't take too long! I have a ship 
  :    : to free!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Event ID: 001
Event Name: EV001
(X,Y): (023,064)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: Player descends down here, inspects the gate, sees 
 :       : that it takes a keycard.
@>Comment: "Keycard" becomes a hidden item at this point and is 
 :       : hidden in the room. Player needs itemfinder to find it.
@>Comment: Once the player finds the keycard, the cutscene 
 :       : takes them back to the gate to unlock it, when 
 :       : suddenly the eastern wall is blown open by Yumemi 
 :       : Okazaki, the player's former university professor.
@>Comment: After talking for a few moments, Yumemi then blasts 
 :       : down the gate leading into the main chamber.
@>Comment: Inside the main chamber, the player and Yumemi 
 :       : discover an abandoned medical facility - after Yumemi 
 :       : inspects it, she discovers that it's not just any medical 
 :       : facility, but an abandoned Cloning Faciliy.
@>Comment: After scouring the area, Yumemi declares the area 
 :       : unimportant to her, and tells the player she'll be in 
 :       : her ship, which is parked just outside the mansion.
@>Comment: Yumemi also tells the player that they can use the 
 :       : ship as a place to rest, as well as a quick port up to 
 :       : the surface. She then leaves for her ship, leaving the 
 :       : player in the cloning facility.
@>Comment: 
@>Comment: The Cloning facility will play a little importance later, 
 :       : as the player can bring Rikako Asakura (in postgame) 
 :       : to the machines and have her fix them.
@>Comment: When the machines are fixed, the player can then 
 :       : use it to recreate the Legendary Pokemon Mew, and 
 :       : later (if it can be figured out how) clone one of the 
 :       : player's Puppets/Pokemon. The machine will need a 
 :       : day of cooldown, to not abuse the function.
@>Comment: 
@>Comment: In one of the machines, if the player interacts with it, 
 :       : they will discover a creature that looks corrupted. 
 :       : When the player goes to get a closer look, the 
 :       : creature wakes up, unleashes a deafaning cry, and 
 :       : escapes into the world.
@>Comment: It is unrevealed what this creature is in Faith & 
 :       : Prayer Version, but this creature was the failed 
 :       : attempt at cloning Mew the first time around - that 
 :       : creature's name was MissingNo, the infamous Glitch 
 :       : Pokemon of R/B Fame.
@>Comment: The Original MissingNo escapes to Gurichi Island in 
 :       : the remote Yitria Region, where it remains 
 :       : undistrubed for a thousand years until the events of 
 :       : Yitria Resurrection.
@>Comment: 
@>Comment: In the Postgame, one of the portals to Gensokyo can 
 :       : be found here. The portal will lead to Chireiden's 
 :       : front gates.
@>

 :       : causing her ship to be unable to leave its current location.

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 021
Event Name: EV021
(X,Y): (028,027)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: It seems to be a diary of sorts. The earliest entry is 
 :    : from February 6th, 19xx.
@>Text: Read the entries?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Select an entry.
 @>Show Choices: February 6th, 19xx, February 15th, 19xx, February 25th, 19xx, March 18th, 19xx
 (When Cancel: Disallow)
 : When [February 6th, 19xx]
  @>Text: February 6th, 19xx
  @>Text: Our efforts finally bore fruit today! The eyelash we 
   :    : managed to find within the ruins located in the jungles 
   :    : of Kikoto has produced a healthy specimen!
  @>Text: The eyelash strand, confirmed to be one from the 
   :    : mythical Pokemon, Mew, contained just enough DNA 
   :    : for us to do a full replication procedure on it.
  @>Text: Though I documented this months ago, it is today that 
   :    : we finally have a stable offspring of Mew!
  @>Text: We shall call this new Pokemon, the clone of Mew, a 
   :    : fitting name - Mewtwo. We now have something we 
   :    : can report to our benefactor as good news!
  @>Text: From here, things can only go up!\n- Fuji
  @>
 : When [February 15th, 19xx]
  @>Text: February 15th, 19xx
  @>Text: Our benefactor is pleased with our results, and we 
   :    : have secured enough funding to get us through the 
   :    : next few months.
  @>Text: We will be meeting up with him and his associates 
   :    : later for celebratory drinks. He says all drinks will be 
   :    : on him, what a generous man!
  @>Text: Onto the Mewtwo Project itself, all signs are good. 
   :    : Mewtwo's growth rate is accelerating, he may need 
   :    : to be moved to a new tank sometime soon.
  @>Text: Several scientists have run simulations and we've 
   :    : concluded that Mewtwo's power will rival even 
   :    : an Alakazam in terms of psychokinetic potential.
  @>Text: Our head scientist on the project, Blaine, has 
   :    : suggested that we create a focusing item for 
   :    : Mewtwo, preferably a large spoon.
  @>Text: While it is a good idea, we should focus on making 
   :    : sure we keep Mewtwo stabilized and prevent 
   :    : cellular degradation.
  @>Text: Ah, it's almost 6 pm. I should get ready to head out 
   :    : for drinks shortly.\n-Fuji
  @>
 : When [February 25th, 19xx]
  @>Text: February 25th, 19xx
  @>Text: Mewtwo is showing signs of heightened 
   :    : awareness; he is capable of understanding what 
   :    : we're doing.
  @>Text: Though he makes no physical response, we are 
   :    : picking up active brain waves in response to things 
   :    : we say and do.
  @>Text: At such an early stage of development, we did not 
   :    : expect this to be possible! This just goes to show the 
   :    : potential of Mewtwo!
  @>Text: Our benefactor is more than pleased with the results 
   :    : we're giving him. He states that we can procede to 
   :    : "Phase 2" soon.
  @>Text: I'm not entirely aware of what Phase 2 is, but it is by 
   :    : his generocity we are able to remain a functioning 
   :    : station and continue our research into cloning.
  @>Text: Mewtwo will be our grand project to show the world 
   :    : just what the potential prowess of cloning can 
   :    : accomplish!\n-Fuji
  @>
 : When [March 18th, 19xx]
  @>Text: March 18th, 19xx
  @>Text: Mewtwo's initial storage tank finally cracked today. 
   :    : We've moved him to a larger one, which sould 
   :    : contain his growth until it reaches its peak.
  @>Text: Our benefactor has funneled us more money to 
   :    : continue our research, he also started telling us to 
   :    : look into further enhancing Mewtwo's abilities.
  @>Text: Mewtwo is already simulated to be able to stand toe 
   :    : to toe with an Alakazam, I'm not sure why we need 
   :    : to go much further.
  @>Text: I am concerned that if we go through with this, it will 
   :    : end up like our earlier, failed experiment. However, 
   :    : we cannot say no to him.
  @>Text: I hope that Mewtwo manages to survive our 
   :    : additional recompilement experiments.\n-Fuji
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>
: Branch End
@>

#------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event ID: 023
Event Name: EV023
(X,Y): (020,024)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: It seems to be a diary of sorts. The earliest entry is 
 :    : from April 23rd, 19xx.
@>Text: Read the entries?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: Select an entry.
 @>Show Choices: April 23rd, 19xx, May 30th, 19xx, July 11th, 19xx, August 8th, 19xx
 (When Cancel: Disallow)
 : When [April 23rd, 19xx]
  @>Text: April 23rd, 19xx
  @>Text: We began the process of recompiling Mewtwo's 
   :    : genetic structure and abilities. The results are... We 
   :    : aren't sure what to make of them.
  @>Text: On one hand, Mewtwo is surviving the procedures, 
   :    : and is being strengthened as a result.
  @>Text: On the other hand, calculations have predicted that 
   :    : Mewtwo's power will scale far beyond our initial 
   :    : expectations.
  @>Text: I submited my findings to our benefactor yesterday, 
   :    : and he was enthralled. He told us to keep pushing 
   :    : Mewtwo even further.
  @>Text: Something about this doesn't seem right to me. I feel 
   :    : like we're torturing Mewtwo. We shouldn't be doing 
   :    : this.
  @>Text: I... I need to address these concerns to the 
   :    : benefactor.\n-Fuji
  @>
 : When [May 30th, 19xx]
  @>Text: May 30th, 19xx
  @>Text: I spoke to the benefactor recently and addressed the 
   :    : concerns of the team. The response was... less than 
   :    : ideal.
  @>Text: He told us not to worry about Mewtwo, and to 
   :    : continue pressing forward.
  @>Text: Like he had no regard 
   :    : whatsoever for the wellbeing of this suffering
   :    : Pokemon.
  @>Text: I didn't think he could be so heartless, but I didn't do 
   :    : anything about it. I'm starting to have my reservations 
   :    : about him now.
  @>Text: The team and I are very hesitant to continue 
   :    : experimenting on Mewtwo, but we don't have much 
   :    : of a choice in the matter.
  @>Text: This all feels wrong. I don't like this. What are we 
   :    : doing? What are we creating? I feel less like a 
   :    : scientist now and more like a monster.\n-Fuji
  @>
 : When [July 11th, 19xx]
  @>Text: July 11th, 19xx
  @>Text: I finally understand what Phase 2 is now. I also 
   :    : understand what a grave mistake we've done.
  @>Text: Phase 2, as the benefactor called it, is an attempt to 
   :    : create a Superweapon in the form of a Pokemon; a 
   :    : Super-Pokemon, the first of it's kind.
  @>Text: He wants to use the project to conquer others 
   :    : without a chance of fighting back.
  @>Text: This... this isn't what we wanted, what I wanted. Our 
   :    : goals were to showcase the potentials of cloning, 
   :    : what benefits could be brought from it.
  @>Text: Instead all we've done is create a weapon to 
   :    : destroy! This is not how it should be! Pokemon are 
   :    : not tools meant for conquering others!
  @>Text: I... I don't know if I can keep working on this project 
   :    : anymore. All of the scientists working on it are 
   :    : showing hesitation.
  @>Text: Knowing what we know now, is 
   :    : this really something we can continue doing?
  @>Text: Even if it means the closure of the facilities, even if it 
   :    : means abandoning everything we've devoted our 
   :    : lives to.
  @>Text: What is the right choice: sacrifice our morality for the 
   :    : sake of science? Or sacrifice everything we've 
   :    : done, everything we could ever do, to spare others?
  @>Text: We... need to think on this. A lot.\n-Fuji
  @>
 : When [August 8th, 19xx]
  @>Text: August 8th, 19xx
  @>Text: We tried to shut down the project.
  @>Text: We tried to kill Mewtwo.
  @>Text: It failed.
  @>Text: Our plans were to shut down the life support system 
   :    : keeping Mewtwo stable. 
  @>Text: It didn't work.
  @>Text: When we unplugged the life support system, 
   :    : Mewtwo's brainwaves went ballistic almost instantly.
  @>Text: It could tell what we were doing and it was actively
   :    : fighting against it.

   :    : But not Mewtwo.
  @>Text: In a classic case of mind over matter, Mewtwo's will 
   :    : allowed it to survive and thrive. Even now, it's power 
   :    : level is rising exponentially.
  @>Text: At the rate it's scaling, we predict it will become 
   :    : concious around late August, around the end of the 
   :    : month.
  @>Text: We can't destroy it.
  @>Text: All we can do now is wait for the inevitable day 
   :    : when it breaks its shackles.
  @>Text: Maybe we can develop 
   :    : suppressants in the meanwhile, but I highly doubt
   :    : that it'll work.

   :    : of this. At this point, we figure the less he knows, 
   :    : the better off we'll be.

  @>Play SE: '000Cry_', 100, 100
  @>Show Animation: [MissingNo], [Exclaim bubble]
  @>Wait: 20 frame(s)

   :    : \PN, take cover!\wtnp[20]

   :              : $>Move Down

   :              : $>Move Up

   :    : expect that to happen.

   :    : unit will help to heal it, assuming it survives that is.

   :    : get the ship back to optimal performance.

   :              : $>Turn Up

   :    : ship's navigational functions are working again. 
   :    : Seems that was the cause indeed.

   :    : remain stationed here for a while to resupply our 
   :    : stockpiles.

   :    : use the ship to get you topside quickly! I'll have 
   :    : Chiyuri prep a teleporter when I get back on board.
  @>Conditional Branch: Switch [0102: Special Battle Switch] == ON
   @>Text: Feel free to use it if you need a place to rest and 
    :    : relax, you and Maribel are always welcome on 
    :    : board!
   @>
  : Else
   @>Text: Feel free to use it if you need a place to rest and 
    :    : relax, you and Renko are always welcome on 
    :    : board!
   @>
  : Branch End
  @>Text: \pn: I'll be sure to remember that, thank you Yumemi!
  @>Text: Yumemi: I should be heading back now. You take 
   :    : care of yourself, \PN. Good luck on your quest to find 
   :    : the Sealed Realm!

Event ID: 038

(X,Y): (014,031)

Page #1
Conditions
None

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed
Speed: 3: Slow
Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Text: A notebook has been thrown in here, there's only 
 :    : one entry inside. It seems to be dated quite a while 
 :    : before the other diary entries.
@>Text: Read it?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: EXPERIMENT M-No. #000
 @>Text: Log by: Dr. Fuji, Head of Cinnabar Mansion Lab
 @>Text: Date: October 19th, 19xx
 @>Text: What: Produce a clone of the Mythical Pokemon, 
  :    : Mew.
 @>Text: How: By using the fragmented remains of a strand of 
  :    : hair, we believe we can replicate Mew's entire DNA 
  :    : structure.
 @>Text: Why: To show the scientific community, and the 
  :    : world thereafter, the positive aspects and benefits to 
  :    : genetic replication.
 @>Text: End result: Failure
 @>Text: Description of Events
 @>Text: Earlier this year, my research team and I had heard 
  :    : reports of the Mythical Pokemon Mew showing up in 
  :    : the jungles of the Kikoto continent.
 @>Text: When we arrived at the destination point, all we 
  :    : could find was one solitary hair fragment.
 @>Text: To date, we're not entirely sure if it was Mew's DNA 
  :    : wegot from it alone, or if any of it was even Mew.
 @>Text: There was enough DNA in the small strand of hair to 
  :    : produce something. Small, but something 
  :    : nonetheless. We gave it the codename M0.
 @>Text: M0, unfortunately, did not stay stable long. It quickly 
  :    : began to engage in celular degradation. The extent of 
  :    : the damage to itself was severe. 
 @>Text: We had to place it in a separate containment unit, in 
  :    : the hopes that it would eventually stabilized - it never 
  :    : did, and the degradation got worse.
 @>Text: It continues to degrade with each passing day. 
  :    : Though, it has been noted to have some... unique 
  :    : abilities that we could not have foresaw.
 @>Text: One of these abilities is the duplication of items.
 @>Text: We aren't entirely sure how it is able to do this, but it 
  :    : seems to duplicate every sixth item we present it
  :    : with after every set.
 @>Text: We tested it with standard items such as Potions and 
  :    : Pokeballs, then tested it with more elaborate items 
  :    : such as machinary and portable data drives.
 @>Text: It also seems to have a minor affect on surrounding 
  :    : electronics, nothing too severe as of right now. 
  :    : We theorize that, as it continues degrading,
 @>Text: it will have a much larger and more significant impact 
  :    : on electronic devices as a whole, potentially with the 
  :    : capability of shutting down an entire network.
 @>Text: All our data says that won't be possible for at least 
  :    : another thousand years, but we've quarantined it off 
  :    : just to be safe.
 @>Text: Official status of EXPERIMENT M-No.#000: Project 
  :    : terminated
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Show Animation: Player, [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Text: \PN: Wait a second! What was that I just read?
 @>Wait: 10 frame(s)
 @>Text: ...\wtnp[10]
 @>Text: \PN: I knew it! Professor Okazaki, I think I found 
  :    : something!
 @>Text: Yumemi: I've told you, just call me Yumemi!
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (-255,-255,-255,0), @6
 @>Wait: 6 frame(s)
 @>Transfer Player:[078: Rock Tunnel], (028,028), Up
 @>Change Screen Color Tone: (0,0,0,0), @6
 @>Text: Yumemi: So what did you find?
 @>Text: \PN: In one of the trash bins I found a log book of one 
  :    : of the experiments conducted here, something about 
  :    : a Project M0, or something.
 @>Text: Yumemi: I saw that earlier but nothing particularly 
  :    : stood out about it, just a poor victim of an experiment 
  :    : gone far wrong.
 @>Text: Yumemi: Why do you point it out?
 @>Text: \PN: Well, if you look at this one paragraph here...
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Show Animation: [Yumemi (2)], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Text: Yumemi: Goodness gracious, how did I overlook this!
 @>Text: Apparently this failed experiment had the ability to 
  :    : disrupt electronics in some manner.
 @>Text: But... it couldn't be that, all of the other electronics 
  :    : here are working just fine.
 @>Text: \PN: That might just be a coincidence, take a look at 
  :    : this section here.
 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)
 @>Show Animation: [Yumemi (2)], [Exclaim bubble]
 @>Text: Yumemi: How did I overlook all of this!?
 @>Text: Not only is it \ncapable of disrupting electronics, but it's in a special 
  :    : containment unit that's been quarantined off from the
  :    : rest! Which means...
 @>Text: \PN: That it's still within this lab somewhere!
 @>Text: Yumemi: Exellent! Let's find the containment unit and 
  :    : shut it down!
 @>Text: Come along, \PN!
 @>Set Move Route: [Yumemi (2)]
  :              : $>Change Speed: 5
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Left
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down
  :              : $>Move Down

 @>Wait: 20 frame(s)

@>Comment: Player enters the room, cutscene starts with Yumemi 
 :       : looking at the diaries and in the trash for clues. She 
 :       : isn't able to find what she's looking for so she 
 :       : continues idling about.
@>Comment: The player then finds the MissingNo entry and calls 
 :       : Yumemi over to look at it, to which they realize this is 
 :       : what's causing the ship's navigational functions to not 
 :       : work.
@>Comment: The player has to find the right pod (which is pretty 
 :       : easy) and try to turn it off. When they do, they 
 :       : accidentally set MissingNo free and it heads off to 
 :       : places unknown. The signal jamming is stopped then.
@>Comment: Yumemi rejoices, then invites the player back onto 
 :       : her ship, and tells her that she can use it as a rest 
 :       : stop, as well as a quick port back up to the surface.
@>

Event ID: 001
Event Name: Nurse
(X,Y): (007,002)

Page #1
Conditions

Graphic: NPC 16

Autonomous Movement
Type: Fixed

Freq: 3: Low
Options Enabled
Move Animation
Trigger: Action Button

List of Event Commands:
@>Comment: This line of code sets the player's current position as 
 :       : the spot they will return to after they lose a battle 
 :       : and lack out.
 :       : Page 2 of this event detects when this happens, and 
 :       : heals the player's Pokémon and wishes them better 
 :       : luck in future.
@>Script: pbSetPokemonCenter
@>Text: \rHello, and welcome to the Pokémon Center.
@>Text: \rWe restore your tired Pokémon to full health.
@>Text: \rWould you like to rest your Pokémon?
@>Show Choices: Yes, No
(When Cancel: Choice 2)
: When [Yes]
 @>Text: \rOK, I'll take your Pokémon for a few seconds.
 @>Recover All: Entire Party
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Turn Left
  :              : $>Wait: 2 frame(s)
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: count = $player.pokemon_count
 :       : for i in 1..count
 :       :   pbSet(6, i)
 :       :   pbSEPlay("Battle ball shake")
 :       :   pbWait(16)
 :       : end
 @>Set Move Route: [PC]
  :              : $>Stop Animation ON
 @>Play ME: 'Pkmn healing', 100, 100
 @>Wait: 58 frame(s)
 @>Control Variables: [0006: Poké Center healing ball count] = 0
 @>Script: get_character(4).pattern = 0
 @>Set Move Route: [PC]
  :              : $>Stop Animation OFF
 @>Set Move Route: This event
  :              : $>Wait: 15 frame(s)
  :              : $>Turn Down
 @>Wait for Move's Completion
 @>Conditional Branch: Script: pbPokerus?
  @>Text: \rYour Pokémon may be infected by PokeRus.
  @>Text: \rLittle is known about the PokeRus except that they 
   :    : are microscopic life-forms that attach to Pokémon.
  @>Text: \rWhile infected, Pokémon are said to grow 
   :    : exceptionally well.
  @>Control Switches: [0002: Seen Pokérus in Poké Center] = ON
  @>
 : Else
  @>Text: \rThank you for waiting.
  @>Text: \rWe've restored your Pokémon to full health.
  @>Set Move Route: This event
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 1
   :              : $>Wait: 10 frame(s)
   :              : $>Graphic: "NPC 16', 0, 2, 0
  @>Wait for Move's Completion
  @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
  @>
 : Branch End
 @>
: When [No]
 @>Text: \rWe hope to see you again!
 @>
: Branch End
@>

Conditions
